product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Adaptive Active EQ, LDAC Hi-Res Sound, 6-Mic AI Clear Calls, 55H Playtime, IP55 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: Have you ever felt the gut rumbling (sub) bass?  As in with a few 18" subwoofers going low and everything just rumble?  Now imagine hearing the same bass but without feeling it.  It's quite surreal and surreal is the best way to describe it when you are wearing this item and it hits the low bass.  You just don't feel it in your gut.  So revelation no. 1, yes, you can hear low bass, and no. 2, the BP1 Pro is pretty good.The item came nicely packaged, unlike the many cheap imports in plain plastic bags or cardboard boxes, it has a properly printed box with Hi-Res Audio (Wireless) label displayed prominently.  In addition, there is a bass label, too.  Never seen that before.  It also displays 55-hours battery life, -50dB adaptive hybrid ANC (active noise cancellation), IP55 splash resistant.  All very good characteristics for a set of true wireless in-ear earbuds.  And let's not forget the obligatory AI product association with 6-mic AI clear calls.  This item simply check all the boxes.  And that's just what's printed on the box!  The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward—the controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Adaptive Active EQ, LDAC Hi-Res Sound, 6-Mic AI Clear Calls, 55H Playtime, IP55 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: Have you ever felt the gut rumbling (sub) bass?  As in with a few 18" subwoofers going low and everything just rumble?  Now imagine hearing the same bass but without feeling it.  It's quite surreal and surreal is the best way to describe it when you are wearing this item and it hits the low bass.  You just don't feel it in your gut.  So revelation no. 1, yes, you can hear low bass, and no. 2, the BP1 Pro is pretty good.The item came nicely packaged, unlike the many cheap imports in plain plastic bags or cardboard boxes, it has a properly printed box with Hi-Res Audio (Wireless) label displayed prominently.  In addition, there is a bass label, too.  Never seen that before.  It also displays 55-hours battery life, -50dB adaptive hybrid ANC (active noise cancellation), IP55 splash resistant.  All very good characteristics for a set of true wireless in-ear earbuds.  And let's not forget the obligatory AI product association with 6-mic AI clear calls.  This item simply check all the boxes.  And that's just what's printed on the box!  The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward—the controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 NC Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, 12mm Super-Bass Driver, 41H Playtime, Bluetooth 6.0, IP55 Waterproof, 4-Mic AI ENC, 24 Customizable EQ

reviews.review: The sound quality is clean, and the 12mm drivers definitely deliver a fuller bass without drowning out the mids. Music and podcasts both come through nicely.The hybrid active noise cancelling works better than I expected for the price. It doesn’t block everything, but it takes out most background hum—good enough for commuting and working in a café. The fit is comfortable, and I can wear them for a few hours without any ear fatigue.Battery life has been solid so far. I’ve been getting close to what the product claims, and the charging case feels sturdy. The touch controls take a bit of getting used to, but once you figure them out, they respond consistently.Overall, these are very dependable earbuds for everyday use. Not perfect, but definitely worth the money if you want strong bass and decent ANC without spending a fortune.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Excellent Earbuds for the PriceI’m really impressed with these Baseus BP1 NC earbuds. The sound quality is great, especially the bass—it’s deep and punchy without drowning everything else. The noise cancelling works well for daily use and definitely helps block out background noise.Battery life is amazing; I can go several days without needing to charge the case. They fit comfortably, look sleek in the blue color, and stay secure even during workouts. Calls are clear too thanks to the ENC mics.For the price, these earbuds feel premium and deliver more than expected. Highly recommended if you want strong bass, long battery life, and solid ANC.

Earbud ANC - It worked to lower the sound but doesn't completely silence outside sounds.Connectivity - No issues foundClarity - Feature that help with this is controlled by the app.Functionality - Features are controlled in the app.Would like to be able to see the battery percentage of the ear bud case but given the compact size, it might not be a feasible thing to do.

I’ve been using these for about a week now, and they’ve really impressed me. The sound is clear with strong bass and balanced vocals. Noise canceling works better than I expected and cuts out most background noise. Battery life is fantastic I’ve only charged the case once so far. The fit is comfortable, and they stay put even when I’m walking or working out. Bluetooth connection has been super stable with no lag or dropouts. For the price, these easily compete with more expensive earbuds I’ve tried.

I’m really impressed with the Baseus Bass BP1 NC earbuds! The hybrid active noise cancelling works incredibly well — it blocks out background noise without affecting sound clarity. The bass is deep and powerful thanks to the 12mm driver, making music and podcasts super enjoyable. Battery life is excellent too — I easily get multiple days of use from a single charge. The Bluetooth 6.0 connection is fast and stable, and the customizable EQ is a huge bonus. Comfortable, long-lasting, and great value — highly recommend!

​I bought them looking for cheap NC earbuds with good bass, and they absolutely delivered. The Hybrid Noise Cancellation surprised me; it quiets background noise well, though it's not magic. The sound is great if you like powerful bass (thanks to the 12mm driver). The battery life is spectacular; I forget to charge the case. They connect quickly and are water-resistant (IP55). If you want maximum battery life and punchy sound at a great price, these are a highly recommended purchase.

Sound Quality – 5/5The audio clarity is phenomenal. Crisp highs, well-balanced mids, and deep, punchy bass make everything from podcasts to EDM sound immersive. There’s minimal distortion even at higher volumes. It honestly rivals some higher-end models I’ve used.🔇 Noise Isolation – 4.5/5While not active noise-canceling, the passive isolation is surprisingly effective. Once they’re in, ambient noise fades away, making them great for commuting or focusing at work.⚡ Comfort & Fit – 5/5These earphones are super lightweight and ergonomic. They sit snugly without causing any ear fatigue even after 3+ hours of continuous use. Several ear tip sizes included helped me find a perfect fit.
Good fit, okay sound. Longer battery life than some of my others.

The fit is comfortable, and they stay put even when I’m walking or working out. Bluetooth connection has been super stable with no lag or dropouts. For the price, these easily compete with more expensive earbuds I’ve tried.

I’m really impressed with the Baseus Bass BP1 NC earbuds! The hybrid active noise cancelling works incredibly well — it blocks out background noise without affecting sound clarity. The bass is deep and powerful thanks to the 12mm driver, making music and podcasts super enjoyable. Battery life is excellent too — I easily get multiple days of use from a single charge. The Bluetooth 6.0 connection is fast and stable, and the customizable EQ is a huge bonus. Comfortable, long-lasting, and great value — highly recommend!

​I bought them looking for cheap NC earbuds with good bass, and they absolutely delivered. The Hybrid Noise Cancellation surprised me; it quiets background noise well, though it's not magic. The sound is great if you like powerful bass (thanks to the 12mm driver). The battery life is spectacular; I forget to charge the case. They connect quickly and are water-resistant (IP55). If you want maximum battery life and punchy sound at a great price, these are a highly recommended purchase.

Sound Quality – 5/5The audio clarity is phenomenal. Crisp highs, well-balanced mids, and deep, punchy bass make everything from podcasts to EDM sound immersive. There’s minimal distortion even at higher volumes. It honestly rivals some higher-end models I’ve used.🔇 Noise Isolation – 4.5/5While not active noise-canceling, the passive isolation is surprisingly effective. Once they’re in, ambient noise fades away, making them great for commuting or focusing at work.⚡ Comfort & Fit – 5/5These earphones are super lightweight and ergonomic. They sit snugly without causing any ear fatigue even after 3+ hours of continuous use. Several ear tip sizes included helped me find a perfect fit.
Good fit, okay sound. Longer battery life than some of my others.

product_name: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds, 12mm Drivers with Powerful Bass, 33H Long Playtime, IPX5 Water-Resistant, 2 ENC Mics for Clear Calls, Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones in-Ear Ear Buds

reviews.review: I am seriously impressed with the Baseus E20 earbuds. For such a compact design, the 12mm drivers deliver incredibly punchy, deep bass that makes my music feel alive.Here is why I love them:Crystal Clear Calls: The dual ENC mics actually work; people can hear me perfectly even when I’m outside.Battery Life for Days: With 33 hours of total playtime, I rarely have to worry about charging the case.Solid Connection: The Bluetooth 5.3 ensures I never deal with dropouts or lag.Built to Last: They feel durable, and the IPX5 water resistance gives me peace of mind during sweaty workouts or light rain.If you’re looking for high-quality sound and great features without breaking the bank, these are a fantastic choice!
These little earbuds are awesome they definitely packs a punch they are loud and have a lot of bass..the sound quality was great and they fit well in the ear
I really like.

I've been using the E20 True Wireless Earbuds for a few weeks now, so I feel comfortable sharing my thoughts on them. I've used them while commuting, working out, relaxing at home, and even taking calls while doing other things. The earbuds connected to my phone in a matter of seconds and were ready to use. I didn't have to set them up again after that. Now, every time I take them out of the case, they connect right away. I thought they were comfortable in my ears when I put them on. They stayed in place for hours without causing any pain or pressure. The sound was rich and balanced, and the bass added depth without drowning out the rest of the track. I also use them a lot to watch videos, and the clarity makes it easy to understand what people are saying. I got many calls while I was cooking or walking the dog, and the person on the other end could hear me without me having to repeat myself. The battery life surprised me as well; I only had to charge the case every now and then because each listening session was so long. The fact that they are water-resistant makes me feel better about using them in more active situations. Despite frequent use in pockets, bags, and the charging case, they maintained their original appearance and functionality. The E20 earbuds have exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, sound quality, and battery life after using them every day for the past few weeks. Whether I'm at home, at the gym, or out running errands, they are now a simple and dependable part of my daily routine. They can be used for almost any activity because they have a long battery life, a stable connection, and clear sound.

I have long been a fan of the quality delivered by this manufacturer at an affordable price. When given the opportunity to take the E20 for a spin, I jumped at it!  No surprise, these are AMAZING for their price point of $19.99 (at time of review). As advertised, the bass is deep and vibrant. The mid-tones are good and the high-notes are not at all "tinny".  I find the stereo to be well balanced though the "sound stage" is definitely on the flat side - but, for $20, one cannot expect 7.1 surround sound. The fit is great out of the box and pairing to my phone was a breeze. With a full charge and some pep in my step I set out the door for a quick run and found that the volume levels are acceptable for exercise and that I could safely hear approaching traffic WITH noise canceling turned on or off. Voices on audiobooks/podcasts were clear and distinguishable while my '80s playlist rocked right around the block.  For $20, the fact it includes ANY level of noise cancellation is shocking so, being that its effect is a bit weak isn't a huge surprise or disappointment.  Operation is simple, with single, double and triple taps on either ear doing the job of answering calls or controlling music/chapters.  The charging case, as always, handles like a wet bar of soap but the buds pop right in and return to a full charge FAST.  Due to their solid sound, easy pairing and operation and PHENOMENAL price point, I give these a FULL recommendation and highly suggest these as gifts for ANY gift exchange with a price limit of $20!

For about $20, these are a good deal. Not the best sounding ear buds I have tried, but pretty decent. Good bass when they are tight in your ears but a little muddy sounding overall. I'm not a fan of this type of earbuds, though, because they don't stay in my ears very well.

I got these earbuds for my mom to use for her daily walks and listening to music at home. She likes something simple and comfortable, and these turned out to fit her needs well. The earbuds sit nicely in her ears without feeling bulky, so she can wear them for a while without discomfort. She mainly uses them for music, watching videos on her phone, and sometimes taking short calls.The sound quality surprised her, especially the bass, which gives music a fuller feel without overpowering the vocals. Connection has been steady, even as she moves around the house, and she hasn't had any issues with pairing or random dropouts. Battery life has also been more than enough for her daily use, she can go several days before needing a recharge. They've  become part of her daily routine, and she's been enjoying having a lightweight , reliable pair of earbuds that are easy to use and comfortable for long listening sessions.

product_name: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC, No Ear Pressure, Hi-Res Audio (LDAC), 40H Playtime, 4g Ultra-Lightweight Fit, 6-Mic AI Clear Call

reviews.review: absolutely amazing! Clear sound quality with rich bass and detailed highs — perfect for music and calls. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well for semi-in-ear buds, making them great for commuting or studying. They’re super lightweight and comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery life easily lasts me several days. I also love the reliable Bluetooth connection and the AI mic clarity during calls. Totally worth it!

Baseus has been my go to brand for charging blocks and cables for a couple of years now. Excellent quality and these wireless earbuds did not disappoint.They deliver really clear and powerful sound. The ANC works perfectly to block out background noise. They're super lightweight and comfortable and you get insane playtime.Calls come through super clear and the water-resistant design makes them durable. Highly recommend these. Amazing value with an affordable price tag!

I’m impressed with the earbuds. The adaptive hybrid feature effectively cuts out background noise, letting me enjoy my music and podcasts anywhere. The audio is detailed and balanced, with good bass and clear vocals. They fit comfortably and feel weightless, even after hours of use. With long battery life and reliable connection, these earbuds are a good choice for daily use or travel.

The Noise Reduction actually works surprisingly well for earbuds that are not the in-ear type. This mode is a bit more "hissy" than what you would hear with in-ear buds. Fortunately the hiss does not increase with volume level, so if you listen at "normal" volume and the music doesn't have a very quiet passage, you probably won't notice it.The Gesture Settings controls offer very good customization options. Lots of flexibility for the tap commands. However, although you can adjust volume level, there is no aural feedback to let you know you've reached the maximum setting. Other earbuds I've tried do have this feature.If you are sitting still or walking, they stay in the ear pretty well. My left ear must have a bit of an odd shape because that one loosens up and doesn't sound as good when it does. The right one is fine though.EQ mode - If you are using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings, the only EQ mode you can use is "Baseus Classic" . If you attempt to switch to another EQ setting, it turns off Spatial Acoustics, which degrades both the volume level and sound quality.The Spatial Acoustics settings actually sound pretty good, but no EQ customization is possible. Personally I prefer the Cinema setting as it is a little less harsh in the high end.Bass Boost - there are five levels to choose from, but none of them have any noticeable effect on the sound.The stock EQ mode settings are OK, but there isn't much difference between them, and you cannot actually see a graph of which frequencies are boost/cut for each.The customizable EQ is shockingly bad. No matter what you do, I will bet money that you cannot make it sound even halfway decent.  Sounds like AM radio to me. Completely worthless to the user.The charge indicator light on the case is pretty useless. There is no readout of battery level, just a single LED indicator that changes color depending on charge level. The highest level indicator - green - means the battery level is between 40% and 100%. That's quite a range! There isn't even a case battery level readout in the phone app.The case does not accommodate wireless charging.Bottom line: these earbuds are pretty comfortable, and sound pretty decent when using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings. If you like to customize your sound with EQ, you will likely be as disappointed with these buds as I am.

I’m very impressed how they sound really good!Just the wear detection won’t activate if you remove the earbuds fast.  They’re light and fits my ear.  Battery last long. But it won’t show me the battery left on the case. Which is odd?Great Buy for sure! 👍I wish Baseus will make high end “semi in earbuds”with high-res codec!

I've been looking for a pair of budget earbuds with good sound quality and decent ANC and have been disappointed with almost everything I've tried. So many make claims that are a real stretch, if not totally false. At full price, these are a solid contender, and on sale are an amazing value. They have great sound quality, especially when utilizing the customizations in the app. The sound is full and natural. The ANC is actually effective. I haven't compared them to higher dollar products, but within this price range I'm really impressed.Unfortunately, I'm still trying to decide if I can keep them or not. I wasn't paying attention and didn't notice that these don't have the rubber ear inserts so they don't stay in my ears very well when I'm moving around a lot. That is by no means a negative reflection on the product. It's just my ear shape and comfort preference. These do better than most though since they're a semi in ear design. I highly recommend them.

Requires an account, personal info, and GPS tracking access (even when the app isn't running) just to unlock full functionality. No disclosure in the listing. No legitimate reason for location tracking. Returning them and never buying from this brand again.Update: The seller reached out and clarified that you can use the app in guest mode and the buds still work without it. They said the tracking is for a find-my-device feature, though I'm not sure why that isn't advertised if it’s such a benefit. There are still plenty of complaints on the Google Play Store about the app requesting access to photos and contacts, and it seems nothing has changed in over two years since people questioned it. These are earbuds, so it’s unclear why photo and contact access is needed. Still, since they contacted me, I wanted to give a fair update to the review with their side of the story.

This has to be the best pair of sub-$100 earbuds I have ever used. They are comfortable and sound great like actually sound great! The fit perfectly in my ears and don’t create any pressure with such an amazing pass through mode. Would highly recommend for listening to music or using with a portable gaming device!

product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Adaptive Active EQ, LDAC Hi-Res Sound, 6-Mic AI Clear Calls, 55H Playtime, IP55 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: Have you ever felt the gut rumbling (sub) bass?  As in with a few 18" subwoofers going low and everything just rumble?  Now imagine hearing the same bass but without feeling it.  It's quite surreal and surreal is the best way to describe it when you are wearing this item and it hits the low bass.  You just don't feel it in your gut.  So revelation no. 1, yes, you can hear low bass, and no. 2, the BP1 Pro is pretty good.The item came nicely packaged, unlike the many cheap imports in plain plastic bags or cardboard boxes, it has a properly printed box with Hi-Res Audio (Wireless) label displayed prominently.  In addition, there is a bass label, too.  Never seen that before.  It also displays 55-hours battery life, -50dB adaptive hybrid ANC (active noise cancellation), IP55 splash resistant.  All very good characteristics for a set of true wireless in-ear earbuds.  And let's not forget the obligatory AI product association with 6-mic AI clear calls.  This item simply check all the boxes.  And that's just what's printed on the box!  The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward—the controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Adaptive Active EQ, LDAC Hi-Res Sound, 6-Mic AI Clear Calls, 55H Playtime, IP55 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward—the controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

product_name: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Premium Real-Time Adaptive ANC, Adaptive Tuning Sound, Natural Fit Design, 6-Mic Adaptive Clear Calls, 45H Playtime

reviews.review: Pretty good for the price. They stay in when working in the yard, and mute the chainsaw noise quite well. Base is good but with a name like Baseus, I kinda expected a bit more low end. Comfortable and a nice, long battery life have been my experience. Overall excellent built quality and the app is useful and intuitive. If the Soundcore Liberty 5 Pros were out, I'd have went that way, but I'm not disappointed with these earbuds.

The Inspire XP1 earbuds deliver excellent sound with Bose tuning and Dolby Spatial Audio. Their adaptive noise cancellation creates a quiet, comfortable experience wherever you are, and the ergonomic fit ensures long-lasting comfort.With clear calls thanks to a 6-mic AI system and robust battery life, these earbuds are a solid pick for premium audio on the move.

The Baseus Inspire XP1 earbuds are amazing! The adaptive noise cancelling works flawlessly, blocking out background noise without hurting sound quality. Music is crystal clear, with rich bass and balanced highs. Super comfortable fit, even for long use, and the battery lasts impressively long. Great build quality too—definitely worth it!

I’ve been using these earbuds for a few weeks now, and I’m really impressed. The sound quality is clear with solid bass, and they connect instantly to my phone every time. The charging case feels sturdy and compact, easy to carry in my pocket.The battery life is excellentI can use them for hours without worrying about recharging. The green indicator light is helpful, and the case charges quickly through USB-C.They fit comfortably in my ears and don’t fall out even when I’m walking or working out. For the price, these are an amazing value. Idefinitely recommend for anyone looking for reliable wireless earbuds

I’ve been using the Baseus Inspire XP1 for a while now, and I’m really impressed! The sound quality is excellent — deep bass, clear vocals, and crisp highs. The noise cancelling works surprisingly well, blocking out most background noise even in busy places.They’re super comfortable to wear for long periods, and the fit feels natural and secure. I also love how clear the call quality is — the 6-mic system really makes a difference. Battery life is fantastic too; I can go days without recharging.Overall, these earbuds easily compete with much more expensive brands. Highly recommended for anyone looking for great sound, comfort, and long battery life!

Overall, very solid buds. Their sound, battery, controls, feel, fit, and in app support is all very solid.Let’s start with the pros.Sound quality is clean with an emphasis on the low and on highs, so a bit of a V Shape tuning. The mids are also very present and vocals sound nice and detailed with these buds. I couldn’t complain about their sound signature since it also comes with other presets that work very well.The fit is nice and snug since the design is made to fit the ear, with a slight protruding bump. Comes with 3 different eartips (one already on the buds).Controls are a better touch to them. They are touch control and can be customized. 3 taps and long press are present, so 4 different control types are there.ANC and transparency are a bang for your buck. ANC is up there for the AirPod Pro 2’s and their transparency is also good enough to still stay aware of your surroundings. It’s not the clearest but definitely great.Their case and earbuds themselves feel premium and worth their price. I love the magnet on them since Baseus products usually have a strong magnet to them.Now for the cons.Sound quality is great, superb even, but the classics bass thump is lacking a bit. I was very disappointed to find out that there wasn’t a bass boost like most other Baseus products have. The XH1’s have it, and so it was mildly surprising to see these didn’t have it.Fit is good, but it could definitely be better. With light use and not as heavy a move, they wouldn’t fall out, but if I were to exercise, these would most likely slip. The limited use of 3 eartips definitely does not help.App Support could also be better. The Dolby Audio isn’t the best and custom EQ doesn’t provide the same experience as it does compared to the other standard EQ presents we can choose from. They sound quieter and a bit more flat. Also, as mentioned the above, the lack of bass boost button is upsetting.Overall, my experience with these have been positive so far and will keep testing them out.

To prefice, for 100$ these are great. Definitely worth the price. They sound really good overall, nothing is emphasised throughout the frequency raise. If anything, it has a little too much treble but not enough to cause listening fatigue. Because of this as well as the punchy, smooth bass and relaxed midrange everything sounds very nice and clear. Zero complaints really. The earbuts themselves are nice and compact, they feel premium, and connectivity is easy and quick. Definitely feels like they'll last for years to come.

I didn't expect much when I first ordered.But now I'm using it for a month, it actually has a really good quality! Sound is clear, and it's really lightweight and fit into my ear perfectly. it doesn't hurt at all even when you use it in bed. It connects to any phones really easily! ( tried on both iphone and androids. Works great! )

product_name: Baseus Inspire XC1 Open Ear Clip-On Earbuds, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Adaptive Tunning Sound, Hybrid 2-Way Driver, Zero-Sense Air Cushion, 4-Mic Adaptive Clear Calls, IP66 Waterproof, 40H Playtime

reviews.review: As a previous owner the Baseus MC1 Pro, I already had high expectations for the XC1.The MC1 Pro sounded great and was very comfortable to wear. Unfortunately I lost them by accident.Having experienced the quality of the Baseus sound product, I had good feelings about purchasing the higher tier XC1.The XC1 certainly did not disappoint. Right out of the box, you can feel that the build quality and design are one step above the MC1 Pro. It absolutely feel like a premium product just by holding them in your hand.The Bose calibrated sound is also a step up from the MC2 Pro, with more pronounced bass and better clarity. The max volume is also higher which helps in noisy environments. The additional EQ presets from the app are also very useful.You get the same level of comfort wearing them - they are so light that you sometimes can't even feel them on your ears. The battery last forever and even when you run out, it takes just a few minutes in the case to recharge enough for a few more hours.Overall, this is an amazing product. For the build quality, sound quality, style and comfort, it is almost impossible to beat in this price range.

Ok, so this review is specifically for using these while running because that is the sole purpose that I purchased them for and all of my insights will relate to that.Let me start with all of the good things about these:1) They sound really good. In comparison to other open ear designs I have tried I would easily put these in the top 3. Bass response is good at most volumes. Clarity is very good and the imaging is surprisingly amazing. Vocal sound like they are in the center of my head. Very impressive for open ear design2) Volume is sufficient. These go loud enough to hear over traffic without any distortion and minimal loss of fidelity. Please keep in mind that there is a level of volume that is loud enough to negate the need for open ear at all. I mean, if it's blasting so loud that you can't hear sounds around you then maybe open ear is not the style for you3) comfort. These feel great. They are extremely light and even when they move around you don't even notice it. I have taken these on runs as long as 13 miles from easy days all the way up to advanced speed work and have had no issues with them shifting or falling off. They do not fit quite as tight as i had expected which seemed like it would be an issue, but surprisingly it was not a problem4) customization. This one is a mixed bag, but mostly good. The app gives you plenty of options to tweak the sound quality and customize the buttons. The only thing it won't let you do is change the single tap function. This isn't a deal breaker and i am guessing it has to do with a hard coded part of the firmware, but it would be nice to have a single tap function that is different on each head phone.So here are the things i think they could improve on:1) The buttons are a little mushy so they can be a little difficult to press and sometimes a little difficult if you are trying to double press or press and hold. I prefer a more "clicky" button that has some physical feedback when you press it. Or even if the buttons stuck out just a little bit more. When you are running fast and your hands are sweaty it can be a little bit of a challenge. Having said that, they are still way ahead of touch controls when you have sweaty hands2) no feedback on button presses. Most headphones have a simple "beep" when you press the button so you can tell that the headphones have received your input. This is useful when your devices take a second or two to respond. They beep when a bluetooth connection is made so I know the capability exists. This could be something they could add with a firmware/app update I am sure, and it would be nice to have3) no "in field" pairing. This set like many others, require the case to be present in order to pair them with your device. I have found a few that will let you pair them without the case and to me that is a HUGE benefit. It's not a deal breaker but that is something i would love to have and would even pay a few dollars more forBattery life so far has been about as expected which is roughly 20% per hour at 75% volume. Not "Best in class" but should be more than enough for most people to use for the dayOverall, i have tried a lot of different brands and models and they all have flaws and they all cost a lot more than these (sometimes upwards of twice the cost) and these have none of those flaws so far.I was hesitant to try a cheaper set from a brand i am not familiar with but i am glad that i did because these are my new daily use headphones when i run.

Baseus really hit a homerun with these. I was a little skeptical at first just from the clip on design itself and the fact that most clipons ive tried have left me feeling disappointed. But these are an absolute MUST buy for anyone looking for a clip on.The sound is awesome, at low volume (30% or so) they do a great job of still being clearly audible and having a bass that is still present. Once you crank it up to 70-80 they definitely pump out some nice sound. Top that off with the nice soft rubber grips and a sturdy fit you have yourself not only a comfortable earbud but a great WORKOUT earbud.The battery life is good as well, i went a whole session with volume at about 60% and got almost 9 hours from them which is insane. The button on each earbud can be customized with many options to choose from which is nice too. I haven't necessarily used them for calls specifically but ended up using them on a discord call and got zero complaints so i assume they must be fine as well.Overall these are easy to recommend for anyone interested in clip ons and especially as a gift option.

Works well. Removed one star because they are loose on my ear. Still a strong 4 stars because minimal audio leakage, good sound, otherwise comfortable to wear.Good product for anyone who finds earbuds uncomfortable as i do.

I just purchased these Baseus open ear buds to replace my old Jlab ones. So far they are great. I primarily use them for music listening while still being able to pick up outside sounds and keep mobile. The Bose bass sounds excellent with no distortion. They are lightweight and comfortable with thoughtful little rubber nubs where they come in contact with your ears. Buttons work fine. I personally like the open ear ring type buds. They look like some kind of cyber-tribal piercing thing, which works for me. I still wish they’d invent an accessory miniature subwoofer that clips into your nostrils through.Update 12/25: After a couple of months I’m still liken’ these ear bud. My only issues are the little control buttons. The ‘feel’ of the buttons when pressed doesn’t do it for me. It’s hard to tell when you’re activating a command. I have a feeling these will not last  in prolonged use. Also the buttons would be better bigger and maybe knurled rubber caps for easier use. I should also mention that the charger case is horrible. It’s larger than the cheaper Jlab one that this replaced and very, very difficult to open. It needs a recessed finger groove or something.

product_name: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds,Secure Earhook Sport Design,Ultra-Comfort,4-Mic Clear Calls, IP57 Waterproof,45H Play, Bluetooth 6.0 Earhook Fit Running Workout Gym -Black
form_factor: Open Ear earbuds /Over the ear earbuds

reviews.review: I've got to be honest, I'm blown away by the sound quality of these cheap earbuds. I downloaded the Baseus app and fooled around with the different sound settings, settling on creating a custom EQ. I admit I'm not a big bass guy but the app also has a "mega bass" setting which I activated and it added volume and a little thump that passed my limited bass comfort. The EQ (and bass) also added volume which is important since these clips rest close to your ear but not in the ear. I use the Shanling M0 Pro (2nd gen) which I've been using with wired Grado headphones in the gym. I didn't feel stupid with the big phones on my head since, afterall, the tennis pros and Lebron James come out wearing big phones. With several earlier buds the bluetooth connection on the Shanling did stumble and stutter a bit which I realized was not the buds but the player. The Baseus buds struggled the least, which leads me to conclude the bluetooth connection is probably stronger. As far as comfort, the 1st ime I tried them, 2 hours later I was in the shower sudsing up my head when you guessed it, I still had them on. I highly recommend these buds.

I'm a big fan of Baseus earbuds. These things are amazing. I gave my last one to my elderly uncle who refuses to get a hearing aid... These are pretty loud and don't crack on high volume. The bass is pretty good given they're open ear.. they're extremely comfortable and very light weight. Battery life is long enough to last all night.. I sleep with them on.
Product had great sound and comfort but did not fit my ears well. I love how you can use the app to tune them as you'd like but due to the fit I will unfortunately send them back.

This review is for Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-ear Headphones. (in case this review is lumped together with other models they sell)They sound great in quiet environments because the overall output levels can't get very loud, made worse by lower bass response than many other open ear designs.In a quiet environment they have a very clean output that sounds pretty good if you aren't playing anything with much low frequency content.  I don't mean it doesn't match basshead expectations, I mean there's country music that you will be disappointed with the lack of strong bass.  It gets more disappointing if you specifically listen to decaf/rebassed tracks or anything that plays below about 32Hz... levels roll off pretty quickly below that, being absent below 22 or 23Hz.Pressing the open ear transducers to close off the open ear gap doesn't help much.  They are about as good as they are gonna get in their natural positions.They are good for most music.Their bluetooth range is pretty impressive.Battery endurance is super good due to truncated bass response below about 30Hz.  Usually I am seeing 12-14 hours on a single full charge, running down to 15-20% remaining.  This is a mix of music, YouTube, calls, and idle time in my work day.Comfort is really good: I can put them over my ears at 7AM and take them off at 9PM without ear fatigue or discomfort.  That beats my AfterShokz models which are bone conduction for comfort, though sound clarity is superior with these Baseus headphones.A breeze above 15mph makes phone calls disappointing, but below that or indoors they are actually great for calls.I will be buying a different set in the near future and giving these to a friend that mostly stays indoors.  Not for me, as I spend a lot of time outside in a windy state.I tried all supported Codecs, and leave them connected by LDAC or AptX HD.  These are good enough to tell the difference between higher bit rate codecs and SBC easily.My biggest issue is that they don't get loud enough for use in a noisy city street, and secondary they roll off the bass output above the bottom end of typical modern country, R&B, or Hip Hop music tracks.I am not looking for extra bass, only balanced bass that accurately plays evenly down to what an organ or bass drum should sound like.So, tldr: good soundfield recreation if you are okay with truncated bass spectrum and lower total output in trade for excellent battery endurance.

Very reasonable. Loud and clear! I mostly wear one at a time at work and one is good enough to hear music clearly and the outside noise. When both are in, I cant hear anything outside unless the volume is very low. Great earphones for the price. I would definitely purchase these again. As a matter of fact, I tried ordering 3 more pairs for Christmas gifts but the order was delayed and wouldn't arrive on time. I was unfortunately, forced to cancel. I'll try again after the New Year of 2026!

I purchased these based on a New York Times Wirecutter recommendation. I'm used to bone conducting headsets, so this form factor was different. They were a little awkward to put on, but only slightly - I likely would have gotten used to it in time. I appreciated that they had physical buttons, making it easy to play/pause, fast-forward and so on (although the buttons could be a little larger). It's not clear if there's a way to turn them off without putting them in the case. The intention is clearly to carry the case around with you at all times - a little awkward, as the case isn't tiny.These didn't interfere with my glasses and I had no significant issues with comfort for long-term wear, at least not from a couple days of use. (I'm practically always listening to podcasts and audiobooks, so I wear a Bluetooth headset all day long). Wearing them around other people may be off-putting: although these are open-ear headsets, so you can still hear normally, it LOOKS like you have headphones in your ears, so people may assume you aren't listening.My only major issue is battery life. The listing is proud to claim 45 hours of battery life... but that's talking about the charge in the case, not in the earpieces. Supposedly the earpieces should last 8 hours. I didn't measure it very scientifically, but my impression was that they lasted about 2-3 hours. Even if I'm wildly mistaken, they definitely wouldn't last more than 5 hours. So these are only useful if you're putting them in the case and letting them recharge multiple times a day. That's not how I use Bluetooth headsets: I leave them on all day so I can play audio anytime, and often for long periods of time. These are fine for a workout, but not for all-day use.

product_name: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds,Secure Earhook Sport Design,Ultra-Comfort,4-Mic Clear Calls, IP57 Waterproof,45H Play, Bluetooth 6.0 Earhook Fit Running Workout Gym -White
form_factor: Open Ear earbuds /Over the ear earbuds

reviews.review: I've got to be honest, I'm blown away by the sound quality of these cheap earbuds. I downloaded the Baseus app and fooled around with the different sound settings, settling on creating a custom EQ. I admit I'm not a big bass guy but the app also has a "mega bass" setting which I activated and it added volume and a little thump that passed my limited bass comfort. The EQ (and bass) also added volume which is important since these clips rest close to your ear but not in the ear. I use the Shanling M0 Pro (2nd gen) which I've been using with wired Grado headphones in the gym. I didn't feel stupid with the big phones on my head since, afterall, the tennis pros and Lebron James come out wearing big phones. With several earlier buds the bluetooth connection on the Shanling did stumble and stutter a bit which I realized was not the buds but the player. The Baseus buds struggled the least, which leads me to conclude the bluetooth connection is probably stronger. As far as comfort, the 1st ime I tried them, 2 hours later I was in the shower sudsing up my head when you guessed it, I still had them on. I highly recommend these buds.

I'm a big fan of Baseus earbuds. These things are amazing. I gave my last one to my elderly uncle who refuses to get a hearing aid... These are pretty loud and don't crack on high volume. The bass is pretty good given they're open ear.. they're extremely comfortable and very light weight. Battery life is long enough to last all night.. I sleep with them on.
Product had great sound and comfort but did not fit my ears well. I love how you can use the app to tune them as you'd like but due to the fit I will unfortunately send them back.

This review is for Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-ear Headphones. (in case this review is lumped together with other models they sell)They sound great in quiet environments because the overall output levels can't get very loud, made worse by lower bass response than many other open ear designs.In a quiet environment they have a very clean output that sounds pretty good if you aren't playing anything with much low frequency content.  I don't mean it doesn't match basshead expectations, I mean there's country music that you will be disappointed with the lack of strong bass.  It gets more disappointing if you specifically listen to decaf/rebassed tracks or anything that plays below about 32Hz... levels roll off pretty quickly below that, being absent below 22 or 23Hz.Pressing the open ear transducers to close off the open ear gap doesn't help much.  They are about as good as they are gonna get in their natural positions.They are good for most music.Their bluetooth range is pretty impressive.Battery endurance is super good due to truncated bass response below about 30Hz.  Usually I am seeing 12-14 hours on a single full charge, running down to 15-20% remaining. These are good enough to tell the difference between higher bit rate codecs and SBC easily.My biggest issue is that they don't get loud enough for use in a noisy city street, and secondary they roll off the bass output above the bottom end of typical modern country, R&B, or Hip Hop music tracks.I am not looking for extra bass, only balanced bass that accurately plays evenly down to what an organ or bass drum should sound like.So, tldr: good soundfield recreation if you are okay with truncated bass spectrum and lower total output in trade for excellent battery endurance.

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Open Ear Clip-On Earbuds, Adaptive Comfort with Anti-Drop Design, Impactful Sound with Adaptive Bass Boost, Adaptive Noise Cancelling Calls, IP57 Waterproof, 40H Playtime, Lightweight

reviews.review: I use these all the time. The open ear design means I can hear my surroundings and the audio coming from the earbuds perfectly. I am an equestrian and use these with my coach so I can hear her better in crowded environments like at shows or windy days. They stay on great and never had them slip or move while I was riding or running. I recently lost the case at the airport and e-mailed the company to see if I could just buy the case since I still had the earbuds. They were kind enough to send me a new set! Not only are these earbuds fantastic quality and a great price but the customer service is top notch and quick to respond.

I really prefer open-earbuds to in-earbuds, cuz after I got some foam tips for better comfort - my ears still get "swamp ear" and get irritated after long use. So I bought Bose Ultra open buds and Shokz open fit buds. Usually I say they are good for what it’s worth. In this case, for what I paid for them, they are not worth it. I finally decided to see if there was a better alternative and stumbled upon these Baseus Bowie MC1 clip earbuds, which seemed like they could be the answer.❤🧡💛💚💙💜Pro’s:The fit is excellent, the sound is excellent, the ear clip/cuff design is different and good, the fit is pretty secure and won’t fall off, comfortable. When running I hardly noticed I had them on my ears. The sound was good when I was running.The Shokz are really good and probably rank them as one of the best hook buds in the market. For me and my ears, the Baseus is an excellent buy. These are light and fitment is excellent, the sound is superb, the call quality I give to Shokz, the update happened to both and somehow the call quality on the Baseus really improved. I still prefer the physical button over the touch sensitive approach that Shokz went with. I still like the Baseus ear clip design vs the earhook. So which do I prefer. Running and exercising-Baseus without a doubt.Bose Ultra is too expensive, can’t adjust to being closer to ear canal, left me wanting and expecting more from the ear cuff buds. They seem limited when turning them up to 7 or 8 on the flat setting. Should be priced around the Soundcore and Shokz open fit buds price, maybe even pricing them lower like $125-$150 on the high end. For $300 they should have wireless charging, multi point connectivity. Most of all a larger and louder volume level. I’m returning them. My Baseus Bowie MC1 do a better job and lasts my whole 10 hour workday without needing to be charged. These are a great option for an open-ear design at this price point, the sound is very full and balanced, impressive bass and volume without becoming distorted, I rarely feel the need to turn them up too much even when in a noisy area.❤🧡💛💚💙💜What I liked:❤1) Very comfortable, light weight, you will not even know that you are wearing it🧡2) Easy to put on and remove and just one clicker on the back of the ear on each earbud to control settings like volume, play next or previous track, take a call or end it or cycle through the modes (default list of modes can be assigned to each earbud so that you can cycle through the shortcuts you use the most).💛3) Pushing it downwards inside the ear gives a higher bass and louder sound. My ears are small so this could be different for different ear sizes. The sound quality is premium and you can move it a bit to find the right spot for best sound.💚4) Call quality is good. I did not face any issues during the call while I was walking outside💙6) You can hear the surroundings while outside, although some level of noise is reduced so that you enjoy the music.💜7) Baseus app enables you to: pair the device with your phone, calibrating the earbuds so that you get good sound quality, selecting the equalizer (bass, mid-range, treble) is available.❤8) The charging case is small and pocketable with good battery life. Up to 9-10 hours of play time and up to an extra 31 hours of battery life in the charging case.

I bought these as a second round choice to some JBL earpods I initially purchased and ended up returning immediately.The JBL earpods would not consistently stay in my ear no matter the provided ear adapter I tried.I was originally hesitant about buying these "clip-on" style ones as a replacement.But after trying them out I was extremely satisfied.They are super lightweight, comfortable, and STAY in place no matter how hard I seem to move or shake my head.I have worn them doing sweaty rough yardwork with no issues at all.Sound/volume might vary a tiny bit depending where the speaker sits in your ear once clipped on.And like all earpods, you don't get the same bass as over-ear headphones...However I think these have all around good sound and listen to rock/metal, EDM, rap, podcasts, etc on them.Charging is quick and easy.Connection/pairing seems to work extremely well and is very seamless placing in/out of the case.Range seems comparable to larger headphones.I would give them 4 1/2 stars, knocking half a star off for better bass (if possible in such a compact package).

I have tried so many earbuds, but they always fall out of my ears. I bought some other cheaper out of ear headphones, but they were garbage. These are fantastic! They stay on, I hear great through them, they hold a charge a really long time (probably about 8 hours of straight use) and the case holds a charge for about a week. They are lightweight and comfortable. A little bit of trouble with phone calls sometimes, but other times it’s fine, so it could be another issue. I love them so much!!!

These earbuds are great. These are the best earbuds that I have found. I like that it doesn’t invade my ear and the sound it’s not compromised. It has really good sound quality, the battery is great, the design it’s cute. The only thing i don’t like the size it’s a bit big for my ear but they are great and comfortable. It’s easy to connect and the weight it’s light.

First of all, I really love this open ear earbuds.  They are very comfortable, loose but still secure.  Sound is good enough, including some level of bass. Build quality is good too.  Overall I really like them and plan to keep them.HOWEVER, after a week of use, I realize the ear buds mic will stop working either when I walk away from my laptop like going to bathroom or kitchen.  It seems the disconnection is random to me.  I am not sure it's because of distance or period of not streaming.  But the worst is the mic will not work properly even the earbuds reconnect with my laptop.  I HAVE to unpair and repair the earbuds with my laptop.  As I use this earbuds for work from home meetings, this random disconnection / malfunction of mic is such a pain that finally I decided to return the earbuds.  It is such a shame.  I did see one another user commented the same issue but I thought that was random.  But in my case, it happens pretty much everyday.... so if you want to use this earbuds for meetings, be careful.  Otherwise this earbuds is almost perfect for me.
