product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro Open Ear Earbuds, Hi-Res Wireless Audio with LDAC, HiFi4 Acoustic CD Sound, U-Ring CurveFit Comfort Design, SuperBass 2.0, DNN 4-Mic AI Clear Calls, IP67 Waterproof

reviews.review: These earbuds are super comfortable and feel almost weightless. I love the open-ear design — I can still hear what’s happening around me while getting clear, punchy sound. The bass is surprisingly good for this style, and the calls sound very clear. Battery life is solid and they’re great for workouts. Definitely worth it!

I’m really impressed with the Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro. The open-ear design is extremely comfortable—perfect for long listening sessions without any pressure on the ears. The audio is surprisingly clear and well-balanced, with a natural sound that makes music and podcasts enjoyable.I also love how they keep me aware of my surroundings while still delivering great audio quality. The battery life is solid, and the Bluetooth connection is stable with no interruptions.Lightweight, comfortable, and very practical—these headphones exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended for everyday use, workouts, or working on the go!

Really comfy! With the clip-on design and soft silicone padding, I hardly notice I’m wearing them, even on long runs. The sound is solid for open-ear earbuds: midrange and vocals feel clear, though there’s no earth-shattering bass. For running, they’re actually great, super lightweight, stay in place, and let you hear your surroundings, which is perfect for safety.The IP67 rating also gives me confidence when I sweat or run in light rain.Bottom line: Highly recommended if comfort and awareness are your priorities. Not for bass lovers, but for running or day-long wear, these are a winner.

Awesome price and valve for these tariff ridden times. A very nice product w/ a wide range use and user friendly. Noise cancellation was not very effective but it hard to turn everything out. Sounds great, looks sleek, functions well minus 150$ for others needs👍

I really like the design, because the U-shape, similar to an earring, makes them very hard to fall out while wearing.The high-resolution sound  is very clear and detailed, almost like listening to an original CD. SuperBass 2.0 is a feature that makes the bass deeper and more powerful, while the high notes stay clear and crisp.The 4 microphones with AI technology for calls makes there’s noise around you, your voice will come through loud and clear to the person on the other end.They are also water-resistant , so there’s no problem using them in the rain or while sweating during exercise. They are comfortable, fit well in the ear, and can be worn for long periods without discomfort. Overall, they offer great sound, comfort, and durability in a stylish and secure design.

I really like these earbuds. I tried other earbuds in bestbuy, and decided I'd rather not waste hundreds of dollars on a wireless earbud set. I am a huge fan of brands that offer their customers high quality items without having a huge price tag, and I respect these brands as long as they keep pumping out high quality items.These earbuds are extremely loud, the sound is 10/10, it feels like I'm listening out of a high quality stereo speaker phone that is in my ear. I love that these DO NOT have touch control, because it makes it easier to use during rain or shower, which I did do today. I wore these in the shower and the sound remained 10/10, something that no other earbud I ever owned was able to achieve. No muffled sound, no loss in quality, absolutely amazing in water.Also, the bass is pretty useless in this, but it doesnt matter too much because the sound quality makes up for it 100 percent.The battery life is good, I've been wearing them all day and they have a very premium build quality.The only thing I prefer, is more tighter or smaller rings, also I am unsure on how long the rubber parts will last. Other than these two worries, this is a 10/10 device and I am recommending them to everyone, and the app is so intuitive.

It is first time for me to use the open ear earbuds. It is so cool! Super easy of use and get connection to my phone. I would like to listen to music during work out, the old style earbuds are easy to get wet and slip out. But the function of this one is supper fit for exercise.The sound quality is just as good as in ear product. The price is very valuable for the good quality!

Disappointed. The sound quality is nominal--nothing spectacular--particularly the bass. Enhanced or not the bass is barely noticeable. The app gave it a little boost but if you are an audiophile and you want them for music, don't bother. The  FF/Next feature and the Previous feature do not work as tapping only results in Volume Control and Pause and Play regardless to the number of taps/beeps. I would surmise that although it is comfortable, it is not suited to all ear sizes because the "speaker" does not position itself in the same spot on every ear. For the price, I will be returning these.

I love that these DO NOT have touch control, because it makes it easier to use during rain or shower, which I did do today. I wore these in the shower and the sound remained 10/10, something that no other earbud I ever owned was able to achieve. No muffled sound, no loss in quality, absolutely amazing in water.Also, the bass is pretty useless in this, but it doesnt matter too much because the sound quality makes up for it 100 percent.The battery life is good, I've been wearing them all day and they have a very premium build quality.The only thing I prefer, is more tighter or smaller rings, also I am unsure on how long the rubber parts will last. Other than these two worries, this is a 10/10 device and I am recommending them to everyone, and the app is so intuitive.

It is first time for me to use the open ear earbuds. It is so cool! Super easy of use and get connection to my phone. I would like to listen to music during work out, the old style earbuds are easy to get wet and slip out. But the function of this one is supper fit for exercise.The sound quality is just as good as in ear product. The price is very valuable for the good quality!

Disappointed. The sound quality is nominal--nothing spectacular--particularly the bass. Enhanced or not the bass is barely noticeable. The app gave it a little boost but if you are an audiophile and you want them for music, don't bother. The  FF/Next feature and the Previous feature do not work as tapping only results in Volume Control and Pause and Play regardless to the number of taps/beeps. I would surmise that although it is comfortable, it is not suited to all ear sizes because the "speaker" does not position itself in the same spot on every ear. For the price, I will be returning these.

product_name: Baseus Bowie 30 Max Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Head Tracking Spatial Audio, LDAC Hi-Res Wireless Sound, 65H Playtime, Comfort Fit, Clear Calls, App Control, Bluetooth 5.4 Headphones Over Ear

reviews.review: Looking for the ultimate escape into your own world of sound? Look no further than the Baseus Bowie 30 Max Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones. These sleek, over-the-ear headphones deliver unparalleled audio quality and immersive experiences, especially with the addition of Spatial Audio.🟥🟧🟨🟩🎧Sound🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩I own many pair of headphones, including AirPod Max, Sonos Ace, Bose QC 45, and the Sony XM5’s. I also owned and sold the QuietComfort Ultra, which are way overpriced. The Bowie 30 Max are quickly becoming my favorite. They sound better than all except the Apple AirPod Max. They are noticeably better than the QC 45. The bass is definitely deeper and punchier. The highs and mids are also discernibly better. The highs are brighter and more crisp. The 45’s require a lot of equalizer use, while the Bowie 30 Max still require some tinkering, they require a lot less of it to achieve optimum sound.🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🎧Spatial Audio with Head Tracking🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪What sets these headphones apart is their Spatial Audio feature, which takes your listening experience to the next level. Feel like you're right in the middle of the action, with sound that surrounds you in all directions, adding depth and dimension to your favorite content. I'll be honest, I thought that spatial audio may be more of a marketing gimmick, but it is incredible. Especially when watching movies, when you turn your head, the sound moves with you providing the feeling of being immersed in the moment. (Same as Bose QC Ultra, Airpods Max)🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥🎧Noise Cancelling🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥I would say, at $99 ANC definetly worth the price. For the low-frequency noises, you know the annoying engine sound, it does the job same as Bose on airplanes! But for the higher frequency noises like people talking, I think it is above average, better than good but not Sony/Bose level. The one thing about the Bose/Sony is their ability to block ambient noise adaptively, but Bowie 30 Max only takes a 1/4 price of them, probably 1/5 with a coupon or a deal.🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🎧Comfort🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦They are extremely lightweight (though sturdy), and clamp down perfectly tight. I can shake my head back and forth without them shifting, yet they’re not so tight as to prevent wearing them for an extended period of time. I don’t work out, but I would imagine they’d maintain their fit during exercise.🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🎧Battery Life🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪The battery life is super incredible and lasts like a full week if you were to use these all day everyday. I’ve had these only like two weeks and I’ve only charged it twice but I use these alot. I think I average about 3-4 hours a day wearing these during the week, and usually charge them once a week, but I don't let them get super low either. Charge super fast, 10 mins for 14 hours of use is just ridiculous.🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥🟧🟨🎧Multi-point Connectivity🎧🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪🟫🟥🟧🟨They also offer multi-point connectivity, and they (and the 45’s) are the only two pair to switch seamlessly between my LG TV and my iPhone. The XM5’s require using the app, the Sonos don’t do it as easily as advertised and the AirPods Max don’t even offer multipoint functionality.🎧If you’re looking for your first pair, then I would definitely recommend the Bowie 30 Max over all the others I mentioned, even if they cost more than $99. I hope that helps. Happy Listening!🎧

The sound quality is truly remarkable for the price range. The noise cancelling and bluetooth are also impressive. You do have to set up the different profiles once in the app but from there it's fairly easy to use and quickly became my default headphone due to the comfortable fit and sound quality. This was remarkable to because I also have headsets which at 10-15x the price, so to say this is great value for money would be an understatement.The caveat - They've tried to give it a more high end aesthetic BUT the plastic used is still relatively brittle and did start to crack within 2 months. The earcups also started loosening. I've some experience fixing things so it's fine as a daily driver but I wouldn't wear these to the gym or on a flight in their current condition.Overall, great sound but it's got a life of ~6 months while I've headsets from Bose or Sennheiser that I've had for 3-5 years so you do get a much shorter life

I have listened to every kind of music genre with these, and I'm never fail to be blown away. The crispness of the instruments. The clarity of the voices. The thundering of the bass. The hair on my arms stands up. I have this test song that I use to grade clarity (don't laugh), Imperial March, Darth Vader's Theme. You can hear each instrument so clearly. You can pick each one out. On another song I listened to, I could even hear the pages being turned by the members of the orchestra, and you could hear the hair of the bow as it went across the bridge of the violin. Insane. Then I use Madman Across the Water by Elton John. You can hear each pick of the string on his guitar in the beginning. Go back and listen to You're So Vain by Carly Simon. I had NO IDEA that Mick Jagger sung the backup vocals. I could hear him belting out the words. I had to look it up to be sure because he's uncredited on the album. He was friends with her and he was just there the day she was recording and jumped in. Lastly, Head Like a Hole by Nine Inch Nails...it sounds like you're in the middle of a concert hall. You dont even have to have the spatial audio turned on for any of these songs, as the headphones are so good right out of the box, in Hi Fi live EQ mode. The ONLY thing I would change about them, is to make a fabric cushion on the headband, I stead of the pleather, because these suckers slide around if you move your head around too much. I tried laying down from a sitting down position, and the headphones made it to the pillow before I did. I'd still recommend them to anyone!!! The sound will blow your mind. Keep in mind, your sound experience is only as good as the quality of the music. The better it was mixed, the better it will sound. 70's music seems to have been more creatively, artistically and carefully mixed for some reason, and there are so many "easter eggs". The coolest feature about these is the on/off switch. You definitely know you've turned them off! The battery lasts forever! The light indicators on the outside of each cup are so helpful to let you know they're charging (blue) and when they're done (red). No guessing! Don't hesitate to buy these! Not at this price!Btw, they DO fold up, I just have a hard case.

product_name: Baseus Bass BC1 Open Ear Earbuds Clip-On Headphones, Open-Ring Comfort with Tri-Curve Snug Clip, Powerful Sound with SuperBass, 4-Mic Clear Calls, IP55 Waterproof, 38H Playtime, Lightweight

reviews.review: Took some time to get used to the feel of these as I've been using inner ear earbuds for years.  It was very easy to connect through bluetooth, the sound clarity on various tyes of music and podcasts are top notch.  I like that there are also specific buttons on the ear pieces so I can raise or lower volume, skip ahead, or take a call.  They're very comfortable and I don't get the constant usage itchiness from having something in my ear canal.  it clips onto my ear very easily with little broadcast "speakers" sitting outside my ear, they fit nicely and haven't moved to matter how much I may sweat.  i couldn't tell you the battery life yet but I've used them now for 3 days and as I take them out of the charging case they're still full of power.  The box says they're good for a totalk of 38 hours, if that isn't the case I'll edit my post, but it seems realisting.  At the sale price I got these for here on Amazon,. I'd say theis was an excellent value and the best purchase I've made this year so far. n

These open-ear earbuds have been a great upgrade from traditional in-ear styles. They sit comfortably without pressing into the ear canal, so I can wear them for long periods without any pain or irritation. The open-ear design also makes it easy to stay aware of what’s going on around me while still getting clear, balanced sound.They’re lightweight, secure, and perfect for everyday use—whether I’m walking, working, or listening to something at home. If regular earbuds tend to hurt your ears, these are a wonderful alternative that still deliver really good audio quality.

These are currently my favorite headphones.  I'll highlight the pro's and few con's (because they are perfect) below...Pros:--Price.  I got these super cheap on sale (~$20).  From a quality and features standpoint, these headphones punch way above their class.--Super comfortable.  They are light but, more importantly, don't feel intrusive.  I love the open ear design.  Nothing is jammed in my ear resulting in zero fatigue, hot spots or swamp ear.  I have taken naps with them on (love being able to listen to music while napping).  Also, as someone who wears glasses, I love that there's no contact of any point between the headphones and glasses.  There's no feeling of pressure or the glasses sitting funny.--Physical buttons (especially at this price point).  I appreciate physical buttons over touch sensitivity.  It allows for precise execution of functions.-The accompanying app.  I think this feature separates these headphones from other low cost headphones.  I love that I'm able to select from different EQ setting to find one that best fits my tastes.  It can also be customized but my ears aren't that particular.  The ability to customize the button functions is also appreciated.--Sound.  To me, the sound quality is excellent overall.  The volume is loud enough against outside ambient noise while the open ear design allows me to hear my surroundings.  Couple with the EQ settings, my music sounds great.  With the volume down enough, I can also carry on conversations without having to remove them.--Fit.  They go with little fuss and stay on!  This allows me to enjoy my music while playing sports.  The only time they've moved out of place was when I accidentally hit them.Cons:--The Finding Headphone feature in the app.  It isn't completely useless as it will show the headphone's last active location but, the call L/R feature does not work unless they are out of the case and in use.  This lack of functionality caused me to think that I lost my headphones.  After replacing them with a different set of headphone that were on sale at the time (Soundcore V20i), they were found in my jacket pocket hanging in the closet at home lol.-Phone calls.  In louder settings, it was hard to hear my calls, even at maximum volume.  The mic, however, seemed fine as I have never gotten complaints.--Playtime (this is the main reason why I dropped a star).  I'm getting nowhere near the 7.5 hour playtime on a single charge.  I may be getting 5 hours at low to moderate volume.  For home use, this is totally fine as I'm constantly popping them on and off.  In the office, however, I would have them on all the time (because of the comfort).  Even though 15 minutes of charge will get me 2 more hours of play to get me through the rest of my work day, I opt to use the Soundcore V20i that I bought when I thought these were lost.  Although not as comfortable with glasses on, they last my entire work day.--Quality control.  This is more of a nit-pick, but the button on the right earpiece is more sunken in than the one on the left almost eliminating haptic feedback.  I can't tell when it's pressed.  This makes using it challenging enough to discourage me from using it.  I mainly use it to increase the volume but will use the phone instead (when it's with me).Overall, these are great headphones and I would highly recommend them.  For the price, they are hard to beat.

I love these! I have the BP1 Pro which are good, but they don't stay put when I'm active, so I'm constantly having to adjust them. The BC1 clip on headphones solves this problem completely. Since they're open ear, they aren't noise-cancelling, but in return you get incredible comfort (nothing sticking in your ear canal) and most importantly, they don't fall out or move around. This design is genius. The sound is different, but I actually prefer it. There's a place for noise-cancelling earbuds (mowing the lawn), but the greater comfort far outweighs the benefit of noise cancellation in most situations. The sound itself is more natural and comfortable for TV viewing and other long listening situations, no ear fatigue. I've had zero issues with them so far, they are definitely my new favorite earbuds. For noise cancellation earbuds, I do prefer my Anker Soundcore2 over my BC1 Pro, though.

Good sound, comfortable, good battery time, but the left earpiece mostly cuts out after a couple miles. Cleaned and charged, same issue on next run. I do sweat a lot, so maybe it's just me, but right now returning for a replacement.  If it would just completely cut out would actually be better, but it just starts sporadically connecting for a second and cuts out, so it's pretty annoying.

i got this one prime day deal, which was mid $20. my airpods that i leave at work were dying and i thought why not give this a try at $25s and after using it for couple of hours and doing some tweaking, i am amazed by it.out of the box, the sound was subpar. at least what i was used to from airpods. but if you download the app and change the EQ, for me i choose Jazz, the sound is decent. again, you have to factor in the price.as far as comfort goes, it's not like you dont notice them on, but it's secure and light enough.i am giving this a 5 stars bc of price. you wont find any good looking, good build quality, decent sound headphones at this price. i think this could be at right under $50 and i would still give it a solid 4.5-5 stars.

product_name: Baseus Bass BC1 Open Ear Earbuds Clip-On Headphones, Open-Ring Comfort with Tri-Curve Snug Clip, Powerful Sound with SuperBass, 4-Mic Clear Calls, IP55 Waterproof, 38H Playtime, Lightweight

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro Open Ear Clip-On Headphones, Hi-Res LDAC & HiFi4 Acoustic Sound, 5g Ultra-Lightweight Comfort, SuperBass 2.0, DNN 4-Mic AI Clear Calls, IP67 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: These open-ear headphones are fantastic! They are extremely comfortable and lightweight, and I can wear them for hours without any pressure or discomfort. The sound quality is surprisingly rich for open-ear design—clear highs, solid bass, and very natural audio. I love being able to stay aware of my surroundings while still enjoying music and podcasts. The battery life is impressive, and the call quality with the 4-mic system is excellent. They fit securely and don’t fall off even during exercise. Perfect for work, commuting, and workouts. The waterproof rating is a great bonus too. Overall, these are an amazing value and one of the best audio purchases I’ve made. Highly recommended!

Was looking for earbuds that felt secure on my ears while I moved around, something I found lacking in the more traditional design. These seemed like a good-quality product at a reasonable price and I'm happy to report that I wasn't disappointed. Setup took less than a minute, and the battery's been impressive, have only charged the case once since I got it last Friday. The buds themselves are very comfortable on the ear. I've worn them sitting at my desk, walking around, and laying on my back and side while also wearing my CPAP mask. They stayed put every time. The sound quality is really impressive, particularly the bass. One thing I did notice was that sometimes a song will start playing on one bud before being picked up by the other one. Thought that was a little weird, but that might've been caused by my phone or the app I was streaming from at the time. I haven't made many calls with the headphones yet but I did demo the mic for a friend via a Whatsapp message. Listening back, both she and I found it to be a bit lacking in clarity, but that might also have been an issue with my connection. Overall, I like these earbuds a lot and look forward to our travels together.

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro Open Ear Clip-On Headphones, Hi-Res LDAC & HiFi4 Acoustic Sound, 5g Ultra-Lightweight Comfort, SuperBass 2.0, DNN 4-Mic AI Clear Calls, IP67 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0 (Titanium)

reviews.review: These open-ear headphones are fantastic! They are extremely comfortable and lightweight, and I can wear them for hours without any pressure or discomfort. The sound quality is surprisingly rich for open-ear design—clear highs, solid bass, and very natural audio. I love being able to stay aware of my surroundings while still enjoying music and podcasts. The battery life is impressive, and the call quality with the 4-mic system is excellent. They fit securely and don’t fall off even during exercise. Perfect for work, commuting, and workouts. The waterproof rating is a great bonus too. Overall, these are an amazing value and one of the best audio purchases I’ve made. Highly recommended!

Was looking for earbuds that felt secure on my ears while I moved around, something I found lacking in the more traditional design. These seemed like a good-quality product at a reasonable price and I'm happy to report that I wasn't disappointed. Setup took less than a minute, and the battery's been impressive, have only charged the case once since I got it last Friday. The buds themselves are very comfortable on the ear. I've worn them sitting at my desk, walking around, and laying on my back and side while also wearing my CPAP mask. They stayed put every time. The sound quality is really impressive, particularly the bass. One thing I did notice was that sometimes a song will start playing on one bud before being picked up by the other one. I haven't made many calls with the headphones yet but I did demo the mic for a friend via a Whatsapp message. Overall, I like these earbuds a lot and look forward to our travels together.

product_name: Baseus Bass BC1 Open Ear Earbuds Clip-On Headphones, Open-Ring Comfort with Tri-Curve Snug Clip, Powerful Sound with SuperBass, 4-Mic Clear Calls, IP55 Waterproof, 38H Playtime, Lightweight

reviews.review: These are the most comfortable earbuds of this style that I have found so far.  I have a few of these clip-on earbuds;  the first one (Tozo) was good, but I wanted a multipoint.  A second one which was a Soundcore, and while it had good sound it was harder to put on.  I'll still use them on a rotation or if I'm doing something violent, because they're very snug.  These Baseus ones, however, became the third little bear's bed that was just right!  They sound great, and I can forget that I have them on sometimes.  I can keep them on all day if needed, whereas I'd need a rest if using in-ear buds or over-the-ear headphones.Customer service is great too.  After a few months, I found that the left side was somewhat failing;  it wasn't as loud as the right side, and had a little distortion.  But they took care of me.  So I definitely recommend buying these if you want a relatively inexpensive but good set of clip-on earbuds.

I love these buds!! The sound is terrific and they are so darn comfortable that I sometimes forget I have them on when I've had to pause the music. They never feel like they are going to fall off, and they don't cause soreness to the ear canal. They are great for work because I can hear what's going on around me, there is a simple button push to pause and also to adjust the volume. I recommended these to friends already! The batter life is fantastic and they are so easy to use.

Absolutely BLOWN AWAY by these earbuds! I previously used my Huawei FreeClips for work, but didn't want to use a $150 pair of earbuds on the job. Frankly, I'm annoyed to have gotten Huawei in the first place! The Baseus are louder, lighter, have a longer battery life, better bass, and with the app, great audio customization. The music/cinema functions make listening to my audiobooks and music night and day!! On my Huawei, these features barely made any difference with the incredibly quiet audio. (You do have to reset this feature every time you use the buds, but I would need to switch between them anyway, so it isn't much of a bother). The custom EQ also made the audio quality much better than what you get straight out of the box! The Huaweis have a higher quality build and technically crisper audio, but they are so quiet it often barely matters. Because the Baseus are louder, they leak audio a bit more, but it's very minor, and in the settings I use them, it is not an issue. Frankly, I believe the Bluetooth connection is better than my Huaweis. When I step out of range they automatically reconnect, whereas I have to manually reconnect my Huaweis. One complaint I have is that the magnets keeping the case shut are very weak and pop open with a gentle brush against something. However, the magnets keeping the earbuds secure are solid and thus have yet to cause any fallage. It mostly causes an issue when it pops open in my bag and steals my audio or calls, but again, very worth it for the price. The build is somewhat cheap plastic, but frankly that doesn't bother me because it's so light and comfortable on the ear. All in all, more than worth the price!

Very surprised by the sound quality of these! Was expecting something that sounded flat like a alarm clock speaker but the drivers in these actually deliver full bodied sound with adequate bass and sharp trebles. The fit may seem awkward at first but my ears got used to them after an hour to the point where I didn't feel like I had them on. The open design on these let me be fully aware of my surroundings, it's like there's just a small Bluetooth speaker next to me. I was also glad I could eat my lunch with these on without them interfering or falling off. The battery life is fine for my needs I completely drained one ear bud and got the other one down to about 50% on a 9 hour work shift. They don't budge and stay firmly in place even with constant laying down and snappy movements during my work day. The build quality is the typical almost flimsy plastic feel that is just expected at this price point but I don't mind. There is a physical button on each earbud that has the usual controls of pausing, skipping, and adjusting volume that works most of the time but I do experience about a 2 second delayed response. For the price I would strongly recommend these, they deliver exactly what I needed to enjoy my music while at work.

I'm really enjoying these for answering the phone.  Long lasting (at least twice as long as AirPods) and they sound great.  They are very comfortable and I hard notice them at all.  I can hear every call.  The Bluetooth distance seems to be a few feet long too.  For the price (got mine for $18.99), you got to try these.

Build quality is not bad, connection is not good at all, it cuts off at 10, 15 feet of distance between Bluetooth and device. And I don't know if only the right one is for phone calls but ONLY my right one works for phone calls, left one does not, I would not recommend these.UPDATE. 11/08/05After the possibly defective product, Hana from Baseus customer service reached out to me apologized for my bad experience, gave me a full refund then offered me an UPGRADED PAIR absolutely free of charge!! Free shipping included, tried them and I'm impressed with the build quality, but more so the sound, they sound very good, with good volume and good and quick connectivity, These are actually way , way better than the Monsters I purchased in sound quality. Some of the best and friendly customers service I've experienced here on Amazon, I could now say I highly recommend the Baseus MC1, you will not regret it!! Oh and if you do get a defective pair. do not worry THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU. Thank you Hana from BASEUS.

product_name: Baseus Eli 2i Fit Open-Ear Headphones, 8.8g Secure Fit, 36H Battery, BassUp Technology & Sound Leakage, IPX5 Waterproof, ENC Call, Comfortable for Cycling,Running,Workout

reviews.review: These are actually surprisingly nice. To be clear, I ordered them because they were cheap and it's nice to have a set in my car for when I'm stuck waiting at a doctors appointment or something. When I ordered them I did not notice they were "open ear" fit. Unlike most headphones of this type they do not actually have a rubber earbud tip that goes in your ear. These are actually just a speaker that sits over your ear. At first this struck me as a cheap design meant to cut costs but this is actually surprisingly pleasant. I feel they are more comfortable. The ear buds that go in my ear can be irritating after wearing them a while. These you almost forget your wearing. I like that they do not completely block out other sounds around you so can hear whats going on around you. Now you might say well but I don't want to hear all the noise around me I want to hear what I'm listening too! Because the speakers are physically over your ear they do block outside sounds notably just not as completely as say a conventional earbud does. I can still hear when someone calls my name or when the alarm on my cook timer goes off but outside sounds are not so much such that  I find it disruptive to what I am listening to. I also love the Bluetooth connection reliability! I'm not sure what the honest range is because I've worn these around the house while my phone was left on the charger and never had the connection break up. I've tested it at least 20-30 feet through walls in other rooms. That's pretty good by my experience with cheap earbuds. The only thing I do not like is the charge indicator on the base unit. It's just a single LED that blinks. There is no percentage bar or battery life indicator. It could be nearly dead or mostly charged I have no idea. This is particularly bad as the batteries for the base are kind of small and it has left me with dead headphones and a dead base that wasn't charging them unknown to me. I also kind of hate the case. It's kind of oval shaped and the top half has a ridge you can grip onto to open the lid but the lower half is curved and smooth leaving you nothing to grip onto. It's unnecessarily difficult and annoying to open and has caused me to drop it several times. For the money I think they are great. They fit well, they sound good, they are cheap, reliable. They represent a great value and I have bought a few pairs just to wear around the house while I'm doing chores or take to work.EDIT: So there is one more thing I want to add to these. I live in a colder climate and typically when I have to shovel snow I like to put in earbuds on so I can listen to something while I work. The problem is I also have to wear a hat that covers my ears to keep warm. Because the elastic puts pressure on the earbuds the classical style earbud gets jammed into my ear canal and is very uncomfortable borderline painful. I either have to take the earbuds out or wear my hat so it doesn't cover my ears which is at best uncomfortably cold and at worst leaves me vulnerable to frostbite, no joke or exaggeration there. These earbuds that just have speakers over the ear and do not actually go into the ear canal can be comfortably worn with a winter hat fully covering my ear. This is a HUGE benefit for poor souls like me who have to work outside in cold climates. Again this seemed like a cheap design at first but I'm increasingly finding I actually like it a lot better than the classic earbud design.

One of the best over the ear phones. It delivers strong bass clarity while helping you maintain awareness around you as you could also hear surrounding noise of your environment. Being through the rain with it and still works great.Unlike the others the Baseus elite 2i open ear headphones doesn't hurt your ears after extended use, I could wear it for extended periods without feeling discomfort on or around my earsIt has exceptionally strong battery life and call clarity is one of the best.  It is a good buy I will definitely buy again.

Got mine today. Some quick observations• Difficult to open the charging case. Frustrating to open. I had to use my fingernail to pry it open. Fix by affixing tape to the inside bottom half of the case and folding it over it itself outside the case creating a full tab• No official app supportfor the Eli 2i fit (Android, ios)  No way to customize touch• No multipoint• Sound is good but goes bad at higher volume. Doesn't sound as clear as the Anker v20i• No neck cord as seen in the review images• Pairs quickly to the last connected device• Fit is comfortable even in bed

I've had mixed experiences with Baseus earphones before; I usually love them but find them to be less durable than I'd like.In this case, knock on wood, not only have I found the sound good and the battery life excellent, they've held up very well to extended use in sweaty conditions. Unlike earbuds that get inserted into the ear, I'm a lot less likely to wind up fostering an ear infection or winding up with part of an earbud stuck in my ear.These are also very comfortable. Eventually, I do need to adjust them, but I can forget I'm wearing them for an hour or more. They're very light.I love that they're USBC and charge with the same charger as my other devices. The case has additional battery that adds an extra couple of sessions of charging in reserve.If there's one thing I'd change, I find it hard to open the charging case sometimes. This isn't a big design issue, but it could use a slightly larger lip for people with short nails to use to open the case.

These are fine. Decent sound and battery life, especially for the price (under $20).  However, with that lower price comes some pretty noticeable cons. The plastic feels cheap. The new case is difficult to grip to open.  Sound while decently loud and balanced has no app you can use to change the sound profile... Pretty much in every area this is a downgrade from the earlier model (Eli sport 1).  If you're okay with those faults these are a good little set of over the ear earbuds, especially for the price.

These headphones are very affordable and work really well. The sound quality is clear, they are comfortable to wear, and the open-ear design is convenient for daily use. For this price, they are definitely worth it!

Very easy to pair to my phone and iPad. I bought mainly for listening to audiobooks and podcasts, but I was just listening to Christmas music and they sound great!. Super comfortable and they are not so loud as to disturb those around me. Excellent buy for the price I paid.
New model. No App support or adjustments yet. Works well. Comfortable. Good sound for open ear buds. Good deal on sale. Have had good luck with other Baseus headphones.

Fix by affixing tape to the inside bottom half of the case and folding it over it itself outside the case creating a full tab• No official app supportfor the Eli 2i fit (Android, ios)  No way to customize touch• No multipoint• Sound is good but goes bad at higher volume. Doesn't sound as clear as the Anker v20i• No neck cord as seen in the review images• Pairs quickly to the last connected device• Fit is comfortable even in bed

I've had mixed experiences with Baseus earphones before; I usually love them but find them to be less durable than I'd like.In this case, knock on wood, not only have I found the sound good and the battery life excellent, they've held up very well to extended use in sweaty conditions. Unlike earbuds that get inserted into the ear, I'm a lot less likely to wind up fostering an ear infection or winding up with part of an earbud stuck in my ear.These are also very comfortable. Eventually, I do need to adjust them, but I can forget I'm wearing them for an hour or more. They're very light.I love that they're USBC and charge with the same charger as my other devices. The case has additional battery that adds an extra couple of sessions of charging in reserve.If there's one thing I'd change, I find it hard to open the charging case sometimes. This isn't a big design issue, but it could use a slightly larger lip for people with short nails to use to open the case.

These are fine. Decent sound and battery life, especially for the price (under $20).  However, with that lower price comes some pretty noticeable cons. The plastic feels cheap. The new case is difficult to grip to open.  Sound while decently loud and balanced has no app you can use to change the sound profile... Pretty much in every area this is a downgrade from the earlier model (Eli sport 1).  If you're okay with those faults these are a good little set of over the ear earbuds, especially for the price.

These headphones are very affordable and work really well. The sound quality is clear, they are comfortable to wear, and the open-ear design is convenient for daily use. For this price, they are definitely worth it!

Very easy to pair to my phone and iPad. I bought mainly for listening to audiobooks and podcasts, but I was just listening to Christmas music and they sound great!. Super comfortable and they are not so loud as to disturb those around me. Excellent buy for the price I paid.
New model. No App support or adjustments yet. Works well. Comfortable. Good sound for open ear buds. Good deal on sale. Have had good luck with other Baseus headphones.

product_name: Baseus Eli 2i Fit Open-Ear Headphones, 8.8g Secure Fit, 36H Battery, BassUp Technology & Sound Leakage, IPX5 Waterproof, ENC Call, Comfortable for Cycling,Running,Workout

reviews.review: These are actually surprisingly nice. To be clear, I ordered them because they were cheap and it's nice to have a set in my car for when I'm stuck waiting at a doctors appointment or something. When I ordered them I did not notice they were "open ear" fit. Unlike most headphones of this type they do not actually have a rubber earbud tip that goes in your ear. These are actually just a speaker that sits over your ear. At first this struck me as a cheap design meant to cut costs but this is actually surprisingly pleasant. I feel they are more comfortable. The ear buds that go in my ear can be irritating after wearing them a while. These you almost forget your wearing. I like that they do not completely block out other sounds around you so can hear whats going on around you. Now you might say well but I don't want to hear all the noise around me I want to hear what I'm listening too! Because the speakers are physically over your ear they do block outside sounds notably just not as completely as say a conventional earbud does. I can still hear when someone calls my name or when the alarm on my cook timer goes off but outside sounds are not so much such that  I find it disruptive to what I am listening to. I also love the Bluetooth connection reliability! I'm not sure what the honest range is because I've worn these around the house while my phone was left on the charger and never had the connection break up. I've tested it at least 20-30 feet through walls in other rooms. That's pretty good by my experience with cheap earbuds. The only thing I do not like is the charge indicator on the base unit. It's just a single LED that blinks. There is no percentage bar or battery life indicator. It could be nearly dead or mostly charged I have no idea. This is particularly bad as the batteries for the base are kind of small and it has left me with dead headphones and a dead base that wasn't charging them unknown to me. I also kind of hate the case. It's kind of oval shaped and the top half has a ridge you can grip onto to open the lid but the lower half is curved and smooth leaving you nothing to grip onto. It's unnecessarily difficult and annoying to open and has caused me to drop it several times. For the money I think they are great. They fit well, they sound good, they are cheap, reliable. They represent a great value and I have bought a few pairs just to wear around the house while I'm doing chores or take to work.EDIT: So there is one more thing I want to add to these. I live in a colder climate and typically when I have to shovel snow I like to put in earbuds on so I can listen to something while I work. The problem is I also have to wear a hat that covers my ears to keep warm. Because the elastic puts pressure on the earbuds the classical style earbud gets jammed into my ear canal and is very uncomfortable borderline painful. I either have to take the earbuds out or wear my hat so it doesn't cover my ears which is at best uncomfortably cold and at worst leaves me vulnerable to frostbite, no joke or exaggeration there. These earbuds that just have speakers over the ear and do not actually go into the ear canal can be comfortably worn with a winter hat fully covering my ear. This is a HUGE benefit for poor souls like me who have to work outside in cold climates. Again this seemed like a cheap design at first but I'm increasingly finding I actually like it a lot better than the classic earbud design.

One of the best over the ear phones. It delivers strong bass clarity while helping you maintain awareness around you as you could also hear surrounding noise of your environment. Being through the rain with it and still works great.Unlike the others the Baseus elite 2i open ear headphones doesn't hurt your ears after extended use, I could wear it for extended periods without feeling discomfort on or around my earsIt has exceptionally strong battery life and call clarity is one of the best.  It is a good buy I will definitely buy again.

Got mine today. Some quick observations• Difficult to open the charging case. Frustrating to open. I had to use my fingernail to pry it open. Fix by affixing tape to the inside bottom half of the case and folding it over it itself outside the case creating a full tab• No official app supportfor the Eli 2i fit (Android, ios)  No way to customize touch• No multipoint• Sound is good but goes bad at higher volume. Doesn't sound as clear as the Anker v20i• No neck cord as seen in the review images• Pairs quickly to the last connected device• Fit is comfortable even in bed

product_name: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Adaptive Active EQ, LDAC Hi-Res Sound, 6-Mic AI Clear Calls, 55H Playtime, IP55 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: Have you ever felt the gut rumbling (sub) bass?  As in with a few 18" subwoofers going low and everything just rumble?  Now imagine hearing the same bass but without feeling it.  It's quite surreal and surreal is the best way to describe it when you are wearing this item and it hits the low bass.  You just don't feel it in your gut.  So revelation no. 1, yes, you can hear low bass, and no. 2, the BP1 Pro is pretty good.The item came nicely packaged, unlike the many cheap imports in plain plastic bags or cardboard boxes, it has a properly printed box with Hi-Res Audio (Wireless) label displayed prominently.  In addition, there is a bass label, too.  Never seen that before.  It also displays 55-hours battery life, -50dB adaptive hybrid ANC (active noise cancellation), IP55 splash resistant.  All very good characteristics for a set of true wireless in-ear earbuds.  And let's not forget the obligatory AI product association with 6-mic AI clear calls.  This item simply check all the boxes.  And that's just what's printed on the box!  The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward—the controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

product_name: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Premium Real-Time Adaptive ANC, Adaptive Tuning Sound, Natural Fit Design, 6-Mic Adaptive Clear Calls, 45H Playtime

reviews.review: Pretty good for the price. They stay in when working in the yard, and mute the chainsaw noise quite well. Base is good but with a name like Baseus, I kinda expected a bit more low end. Comfortable and a nice, long battery life have been my experience. Overall excellent built quality and the app is useful and intuitive. If the Soundcore Liberty 5 Pros were out, I'd have went that way, but I'm not disappointed with these earbuds.

The Inspire XP1 earbuds deliver excellent sound with Bose tuning and Dolby Spatial Audio. Their adaptive noise cancellation creates a quiet, comfortable experience wherever you are, and the ergonomic fit ensures long-lasting comfort.With clear calls thanks to a 6-mic AI system and robust battery life, these earbuds are a solid pick for premium audio on the move.

The Baseus Inspire XP1 earbuds are amazing! The adaptive noise cancelling works flawlessly, blocking out background noise without hurting sound quality. Music is crystal clear, with rich bass and balanced highs. Super comfortable fit, even for long use, and the battery lasts impressively long. Great build quality too—definitely worth it!

I’ve been using these earbuds for a few weeks now, and I’m really impressed. The sound quality is clear with solid bass, and they connect instantly to my phone every time. The charging case feels sturdy and compact, easy to carry in my pocket.The battery life is excellentI can use them for hours without worrying about recharging. The green indicator light is helpful, and the case charges quickly through USB-C.They fit comfortably in my ears and don’t fall out even when I’m walking or working out. For the price, these are an amazing value. Idefinitely recommend for anyone looking for reliable wireless earbuds

I’ve been using the Baseus Inspire XP1 for a while now, and I’m really impressed! The sound quality is excellent — deep bass, clear vocals, and crisp highs. The noise cancelling works surprisingly well, blocking out most background noise even in busy places.They’re super comfortable to wear for long periods, and the fit feels natural and secure. I also love how clear the call quality is — the 6-mic system really makes a difference. Battery life is fantastic too; I can go days without recharging.Overall, these earbuds easily compete with much more expensive brands. Highly recommended for anyone looking for great sound, comfort, and long battery life!

Overall, very solid buds. Their sound, battery, controls, feel, fit, and in app support is all very solid.Let’s start with the pros.Sound quality is clean with an emphasis on the low and on highs, so a bit of a V Shape tuning. The mids are also very present and vocals sound nice and detailed with these buds. I couldn’t complain about their sound signature since it also comes with other presets that work very well.The fit is nice and snug since the design is made to fit the ear, with a slight protruding bump. Comes with 3 different eartips (one already on the buds).Controls are a better touch to them. They are touch control and can be customized. 3 taps and long press are present, so 4 different control types are there.ANC and transparency are a bang for your buck. ANC is up there for the AirPod Pro 2’s and their transparency is also good enough to still stay aware of your surroundings. It’s not the clearest but definitely great.Their case and earbuds themselves feel premium and worth their price. I love the magnet on them since Baseus products usually have a strong magnet to them.Now for the cons.Sound quality is great, superb even, but the classics bass thump is lacking a bit. I was very disappointed to find out that there wasn’t a bass boost like most other Baseus products have. The XH1’s have it, and so it was mildly surprising to see these didn’t have it.Fit is good, but it could definitely be better. With light use and not as heavy a move, they wouldn’t fall out, but if I were to exercise, these would most likely slip. The limited use of 3 eartips definitely does not help.App Support could also be better. The Dolby Audio isn’t the best and custom EQ doesn’t provide the same experience as it does compared to the other standard EQ presents we can choose from. They sound quieter and a bit more flat. Also, as mentioned the above, the lack of bass boost button is upsetting.Overall, my experience with these have been positive so far and will keep testing them out.

To prefice, for 100$ these are great. Definitely worth the price. They sound really good overall, nothing is emphasised throughout the frequency raise. If anything, it has a little too much treble but not enough to cause listening fatigue. Because of this as well as the punchy, smooth bass and relaxed midrange everything sounds very nice and clear. Zero complaints really. The earbuts themselves are nice and compact, they feel premium, and connectivity is easy and quick. Definitely feels like they'll last for years to come.

I didn't expect much when I first ordered.But now I'm using it for a month, it actually has a really good quality! Sound is clear, and it's really lightweight and fit into my ear perfectly. it doesn't hurt at all even when you use it in bed. It connects to any phones really easily! ( tried on both iphone and androids. Works great! )

product_name: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Premium Real-Time Adaptive ANC, Adaptive Tuning Sound, Natural Fit Design, 6-Mic Adaptive Clear Calls, 45H Playtime

product_name: Baseus Bass BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC, Hi-Res Audio (LDAC), 40H Playtime, 4g Ultra-Lightweight Fit, 6-Mic AI Clear Call, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: absolutely amazing! Clear sound quality with rich bass and detailed highs — perfect for music and calls. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well for semi-in-ear buds, making them great for commuting or studying. They’re super lightweight and comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery life easily lasts me several days. I also love the reliable Bluetooth connection and the AI mic clarity during calls. Totally worth it!

Baseus has been my go to brand for charging blocks and cables for a couple of years now. Excellent quality and these wireless earbuds did not disappoint.They deliver really clear and powerful sound. The ANC works perfectly to block out background noise. They're super lightweight and comfortable and you get insane playtime.Calls come through super clear and the water-resistant design makes them durable. Highly recommend these. Amazing value with an affordable price tag!

I’m impressed with the earbuds. The adaptive hybrid feature effectively cuts out background noise, letting me enjoy my music and podcasts anywhere. The audio is detailed and balanced, with good bass and clear vocals. They fit comfortably and feel weightless, even after hours of use. With long battery life and reliable connection, these earbuds are a good choice for daily use or travel.

The Noise Reduction actually works surprisingly well for earbuds that are not the in-ear type. This mode is a bit more "hissy" than what you would hear with in-ear buds. Fortunately the hiss does not increase with volume level, so if you listen at "normal" volume and the music doesn't have a very quiet passage, you probably won't notice it.The Gesture Settings controls offer very good customization options. Lots of flexibility for the tap commands. However, although you can adjust volume level, there is no aural feedback to let you know you've reached the maximum setting. Other earbuds I've tried do have this feature.If you are sitting still or walking, they stay in the ear pretty well. My left ear must have a bit of an odd shape because that one loosens up and doesn't sound as good when it does. The right one is fine though.EQ mode - If you are using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings, the only EQ mode you can use is "Baseus Classic" . If you attempt to switch to another EQ setting, it turns off Spatial Acoustics, which degrades both the volume level and sound quality.The Spatial Acoustics settings actually sound pretty good, but no EQ customization is possible. Personally I prefer the Cinema setting as it is a little less harsh in the high end.Bass Boost - there are five levels to choose from, but none of them have any noticeable effect on the sound.The stock EQ mode settings are OK, but there isn't much difference between them, and you cannot actually see a graph of which frequencies are boost/cut for each.The customizable EQ is shockingly bad. No matter what you do, I will bet money that you cannot make it sound even halfway decent.  Sounds like AM radio to me. Completely worthless to the user.The charge indicator light on the case is pretty useless. There is no readout of battery level, just a single LED indicator that changes color depending on charge level. The highest level indicator - green - means the battery level is between 40% and 100%. That's quite a range! There isn't even a case battery level readout in the phone app.The case does not accommodate wireless charging.Bottom line: these earbuds are pretty comfortable, and sound pretty decent when using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings. If you like to customize your sound with EQ, you will likely be as disappointed with these buds as I am.

I’m very impressed how they sound really good!Just the wear detection won’t activate if you remove the earbuds fast.  They’re light and fits my ear.  Battery last long. But it won’t show me the battery left on the case. Which is odd?Great Buy for sure! 👍I wish Baseus will make high end “semi in earbuds”with high-res codec!

I've been looking for a pair of budget earbuds with good sound quality and decent ANC and have been disappointed with almost everything I've tried. So many make claims that are a real stretch, if not totally false. At full price, these are a solid contender, and on sale are an amazing value. They have great sound quality, especially when utilizing the customizations in the app. The sound is full and natural. The ANC is actually effective. I haven't compared them to higher dollar products, but within this price range I'm really impressed.Unfortunately, I'm still trying to decide if I can keep them or not. I wasn't paying attention and didn't notice that these don't have the rubber ear inserts so they don't stay in my ears very well when I'm moving around a lot. That is by no means a negative reflection on the product. It's just my ear shape and comfort preference. These do better than most though since they're a semi in ear design. I highly recommend them.

Requires an account, personal info, and GPS tracking access (even when the app isn't running) just to unlock full functionality. No disclosure in the listing. No legitimate reason for location tracking. Returning them and never buying from this brand again.Update: The seller reached out and clarified that you can use the app in guest mode and the buds still work without it. They said the tracking is for a find-my-device feature, though I'm not sure why that isn't advertised if it’s such a benefit. There are still plenty of complaints on the Google Play Store about the app requesting access to photos and contacts, and it seems nothing has changed in over two years since people questioned it. These are earbuds, so it’s unclear why photo and contact access is needed. Still, since they contacted me, I wanted to give a fair update to the review with their side of the story.

This has to be the best pair of sub-$100 earbuds I have ever used. They are comfortable and sound great like actually sound great! The fit perfectly in my ears and don’t create any pressure with such an amazing pass through mode. Would highly recommend for listening to music or using with a portable gaming device!
