product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro Open Ear Clip-On Headphones, Hi-Res LDAC & HiFi4 Acoustic Sound, 5g Ultra-Lightweight Comfort, SuperBass 2.0, DNN 4-Mic AI Clear Calls, IP67 Waterproof, Bluetooth 6.0

reviews.review: These open-ear headphones are fantastic! They are extremely comfortable and lightweight, and I can wear them for hours without any pressure or discomfort. The sound quality is surprisingly rich for open-ear design—clear highs, solid bass, and very natural audio. I love being able to stay aware of my surroundings while still enjoying music and podcasts. The battery life is impressive, and the call quality with the 4-mic system is excellent. They fit securely and don’t fall off even during exercise. Perfect for work, commuting, and workouts. The waterproof rating is a great bonus too. Overall, these are an amazing value and one of the best audio purchases I’ve made. Highly recommended!

Was looking for earbuds that felt secure on my ears while I moved around, something I found lacking in the more traditional design. These seemed like a good-quality product at a reasonable price and I'm happy to report that I wasn't disappointed. Setup took less than a minute, and the battery's been impressive, have only charged the case once since I got it last Friday. The buds themselves are very comfortable on the ear. I've worn them sitting at my desk, walking around, and laying on my back and side while also wearing my CPAP mask. They stayed put every time. The sound quality is really impressive, particularly the bass. One thing I did notice was that sometimes a song will start playing on one bud before being picked up by the other one. Thought that was a little weird, but that might've been caused by my phone or the app I was streaming from at the time. I haven't made many calls with the headphones yet but I did demo the mic for a friend via a Whatsapp message. Listening back, both she and I found it to be a bit lacking in clarity, but that might also have been an issue with my connection. Overall, I like these earbuds a lot and look forward to our travels together.

product_name: Baseus Eli 2i Fit Open-Ear Headphones, 8.8g Secure Fit, 36H Battery, BassUp Technology & Sound Leakage, IPX5 Waterproof, ENC Call, Comfortable for Cycling,Running,Workout

reviews.review: These are actually surprisingly nice. To be clear, I ordered them because they were cheap and it's nice to have a set in my car for when I'm stuck waiting at a doctors appointment or something. When I ordered them I did not notice they were "open ear" fit. Unlike most headphones of this type they do not actually have a rubber earbud tip that goes in your ear. These are actually just a speaker that sits over your ear. At first this struck me as a cheap design meant to cut costs but this is actually surprisingly pleasant. I feel they are more comfortable. The ear buds that go in my ear can be irritating after wearing them a while. These you almost forget your wearing. I like that they do not completely block out other sounds around you so can hear whats going on around you. Now you might say well but I don't want to hear all the noise around me I want to hear what I'm listening too! Because the speakers are physically over your ear they do block outside sounds notably just not as completely as say a conventional earbud does. I can still hear when someone calls my name or when the alarm on my cook timer goes off but outside sounds are not so much such that  I find it disruptive to what I am listening to. I also love the Bluetooth connection reliability! I'm not sure what the honest range is because I've worn these around the house while my phone was left on the charger and never had the connection break up. I've tested it at least 20-30 feet through walls in other rooms. That's pretty good by my experience with cheap earbuds. The only thing I do not like is the charge indicator on the base unit. It's just a single LED that blinks. There is no percentage bar or battery life indicator. It could be nearly dead or mostly charged I have no idea. This is particularly bad as the batteries for the base are kind of small and it has left me with dead headphones and a dead base that wasn't charging them unknown to me. I also kind of hate the case. It's kind of oval shaped and the top half has a ridge you can grip onto to open the lid but the lower half is curved and smooth leaving you nothing to grip onto. It's unnecessarily difficult and annoying to open and has caused me to drop it several times. For the money I think they are great. They fit well, they sound good, they are cheap, reliable. They represent a great value and I have bought a few pairs just to wear around the house while I'm doing chores or take to work.EDIT: So there is one more thing I want to add to these. I live in a colder climate and typically when I have to shovel snow I like to put in earbuds on so I can listen to something while I work. The problem is I also have to wear a hat that covers my ears to keep warm. Because the elastic puts pressure on the earbuds the classical style earbud gets jammed into my ear canal and is very uncomfortable borderline painful. I either have to take the earbuds out or wear my hat so it doesn't cover my ears which is at best uncomfortably cold and at worst leaves me vulnerable to frostbite, no joke or exaggeration there. These earbuds that just have speakers over the ear and do not actually go into the ear canal can be comfortably worn with a winter hat fully covering my ear. This is a HUGE benefit for poor souls like me who have to work outside in cold climates. Again this seemed like a cheap design at first but I'm increasingly finding I actually like it a lot better than the classic earbud design.

One of the best over the ear phones. It delivers strong bass clarity while helping you maintain awareness around you as you could also hear surrounding noise of your environment. Being through the rain with it and still works great.Unlike the others the Baseus elite 2i open ear headphones doesn't hurt your ears after extended use, I could wear it for extended periods without feeling discomfort on or around my earsIt has exceptionally strong battery life and call clarity is one of the best.  It is a good buy I will definitely buy again.

Got mine today. Some quick observations• Difficult to open the charging case. Frustrating to open. I had to use my fingernail to pry it open. Fix by affixing tape to the inside bottom half of the case and folding it over it itself outside the case creating a full tab• No official app supportfor the Eli 2i fit (Android, ios)  No way to customize touch• No multipoint• Sound is good but goes bad at higher volume. Doesn't sound as clear as the Anker v20i• No neck cord as seen in the review images• Pairs quickly to the last connected device• Fit is comfortable even in bed

I've had mixed experiences with Baseus earphones before; I usually love them but find them to be less durable than I'd like.In this case, knock on wood, not only have I found the sound good and the battery life excellent, they've held up very well to extended use in sweaty conditions. Unlike earbuds that get inserted into the ear, I'm a lot less likely to wind up fostering an ear infection or winding up with part of an earbud stuck in my ear.These are also very comfortable. Eventually, I do need to adjust them, but I can forget I'm wearing them for an hour or more. They're very light.I love that they're USBC and charge with the same charger as my other devices. The case has additional battery that adds an extra couple of sessions of charging in reserve.If there's one thing I'd change, I find it hard to open the charging case sometimes. This isn't a big design issue, but it could use a slightly larger lip for people with short nails to use to open the case.

These are fine. Decent sound and battery life, especially for the price (under $20).  However, with that lower price comes some pretty noticeable cons. The plastic feels cheap. The new case is difficult to grip to open.  Sound while decently loud and balanced has no app you can use to change the sound profile... Pretty much in every area this is a downgrade from the earlier model (Eli sport 1).  If you're okay with those faults these are a good little set of over the ear earbuds, especially for the price.

These headphones are very affordable and work really well. The sound quality is clear, they are comfortable to wear, and the open-ear design is convenient for daily use. For this price, they are definitely worth it!

Very easy to pair to my phone and iPad. I bought mainly for listening to audiobooks and podcasts, but I was just listening to Christmas music and they sound great!. Super comfortable and they are not so loud as to disturb those around me. Excellent buy for the price I paid.
New model. No App support or adjustments yet. Works well. Comfortable. Good sound for open ear buds. Good deal on sale. Have had good luck with other Baseus headphones.

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro Open Ear Earbuds, Hi-Res Wireless Audio with LDAC, HiFi4 Acoustic CD Sound, U-Ring CurveFit Comfort Design, SuperBass 2.0, DNN 4-Mic AI Clear Calls, IP67 Waterproof (Titanium)

reviews.review: These earbuds are super comfortable and feel almost weightless. I love the open-ear design — I can still hear what’s happening around me while getting clear, punchy sound. The bass is surprisingly good for this style, and the calls sound very clear. Battery life is solid and they’re great for workouts. Definitely worth it!

I’m really impressed with the Baseus Bowie MC1 Pro. The open-ear design is extremely comfortable—perfect for long listening sessions without any pressure on the ears. The audio is surprisingly clear and well-balanced, with a natural sound that makes music and podcasts enjoyable.I also love how they keep me aware of my surroundings while still delivering great audio quality. The battery life is solid, and the Bluetooth connection is stable with no interruptions.Lightweight, comfortable, and very practical—these headphones exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended for everyday use, workouts, or working on the go!

Really comfy! With the clip-on design and soft silicone padding, I hardly notice I’m wearing them, even on long runs. The sound is solid for open-ear earbuds: midrange and vocals feel clear, though there’s no earth-shattering bass. For running, they’re actually great, super lightweight, stay in place, and let you hear your surroundings, which is perfect for safety.The IP67 rating also gives me confidence when I sweat or run in light rain.Bottom line: Highly recommended if comfort and awareness are your priorities. Not for bass lovers, but for running or day-long wear, these are a winner.

Awesome price and valve for these tariff ridden times. A very nice product w/ a wide range use and user friendly. Noise cancellation was not very effective but it hard to turn everything out. Sounds great, looks sleek, functions well minus 150$ for others needs👍

I really like the design, because the U-shape, similar to an earring, makes them very hard to fall out while wearing.The high-resolution sound  is very clear and detailed, almost like listening to an original CD. SuperBass 2.0 is a feature that makes the bass deeper and more powerful, while the high notes stay clear and crisp.The 4 microphones with AI technology for calls makes there’s noise around you, your voice will come through loud and clear to the person on the other end.They are also water-resistant , so there’s no problem using them in the rain or while sweating during exercise. They are comfortable, fit well in the ear, and can be worn for long periods without discomfort. Overall, they offer great sound, comfort, and durability in a stylish and secure design.

I really like these earbuds. I tried other earbuds in bestbuy, and decided I'd rather not waste hundreds of dollars on a wireless earbud set. I am a huge fan of brands that offer their customers high quality items without having a huge price tag, and I respect these brands as long as they keep pumping out high quality items.These earbuds are extremely loud, the sound is 10/10, it feels like I'm listening out of a high quality stereo speaker phone that is in my ear. I love that these DO NOT have touch control, because it makes it easier to use during rain or shower, which I did do today. I wore these in the shower and the sound remained 10/10, something that no other earbud I ever owned was able to achieve. No muffled sound, no loss in quality, absolutely amazing in water.Also, the bass is pretty useless in this, but it doesnt matter too much because the sound quality makes up for it 100 percent.The battery life is good, I've been wearing them all day and they have a very premium build quality.The only thing I prefer, is more tighter or smaller rings, also I am unsure on how long the rubber parts will last. Other than these two worries, this is a 10/10 device and I am recommending them to everyone, and the app is so intuitive.

It is first time for me to use the open ear earbuds. It is so cool! Super easy of use and get connection to my phone. I would like to listen to music during work out, the old style earbuds are easy to get wet and slip out. But the function of this one is supper fit for exercise.The sound quality is just as good as in ear product. The price is very valuable for the good quality!

Disappointed. The sound quality is nominal--nothing spectacular--particularly the bass. Enhanced or not the bass is barely noticeable. The app gave it a little boost but if you are an audiophile and you want them for music, don't bother. The  FF/Next feature and the Previous feature do not work as tapping only results in Volume Control and Pause and Play regardless to the number of taps/beeps. I would surmise that although it is comfortable, it is not suited to all ear sizes because the "speaker" does not position itself in the same spot on every ear. For the price, I will be returning these.

product_name: Baseus Inspire XH1 Adaptive Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Premium Real-Time Adaptive ANC, Adaptive Tuning Rich Sound, Hi-Res Audio, 100H Playtime - Sunset Coral

reviews.review: I’ve been using these headphones almost every day for a week and I’m honestly really impressed. The sound quality is rich, clear, and perfectly balanced for both music and movies. The noise cancelling works great and really helps me focus when I’m working or traveling. They’re super comfortable too — the ear pads are soft and don’t get hot even after hours of use. The battery life is amazing; I only need to charge them once a week. The build feels solid and the design looks very clean and premium. Overall, these headphones are a fantastic value for the price and I’d definitely recommend them to anyone looking for great sound and comfort!

I recently got the Baseus Inspire XH1 Adaptive Active Noise Cancelling Headphones in Cosmic Black, and I must say, they have exceeded my expectations! The sound quality is simply phenomenal, thanks to Sound by Bose and Dolby Spatial Audio. It's like being enveloped in a 360° soundscape, making my music and podcasts come alive. The noise cancellation is impressive, blocking out almost all surrounding noise, which is perfect for my noisy office environment. What I love most is how comfortable they are; I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. The battery life is outstanding, lasting me several days without needing a charge. Also, the Bluetooth connection is quick and super stable. For the price, these headphones outperform even more expensive brands, making them a fantastic investment.

These headphones punch above their price! Please, be advised that to get the most out of these headphones you have to do 4 things out of the box: (1) charge it full, (2) download the app, which is awesome, and connect the headphones to the bluetooth source, (3) update the headphones’ firmware, (4) go to the Soundfit feature and follow the instructions step by step. Soundfit actually adjusts the headphone sound to the sound frequencies as you hear then! Once Soundfit works its magic, test the headphones to your favorite music or movie. To my ears, they sound awesome! If you have android equipment, turn on the LDAC to get cd quality sound. The controls are physical and easy to use and can be adjusted via the app, which also allows you to equalize the sound to your liking or choose between the Sound by Bose (my favorite setting), Dolby or extra Bass, or any other of the aound presets.Wireless connectivity is great and I had no issues with calls. They are comfortable and fit alright to my head. They seem well built and are heavy compared to good headphones like the $30 Tozo HT2. As fir durability, time will tell. For the Black Friday price of $99.99 that includes a storage case (that by itself would sell for $10-$20) and a free gift, these headphones are a no brainer buy!

I think it's important to mention I have an IOS phone(apple) and a windows laptop. I wish more people mentioned this in their reviews more often to compare compatibility. I think this set would work best for an Android device, imo.My first set stopped working on the second day I used them, they were gimmicked, so Amazon did a quick replacement for me. The new pair worked better.Pros: amazing quality soundComfortableComes with a nice caseThey're lightweightPrice worth getting vs name brandsGreat battery life (headphones) *see consCons: they suddenly disconnect at random sometimes, and then i have to reconnect to my BT device. (Not sure if it's a power saver mode for the headphones)The battery life seems great on the headphones, but after downloading the baseus app, I've noticed the battery on my phone has been draining a lot faster than usual.The noise cancelling is a bit better indoors, but outdoors, it does not cancel noise at all.Not even for phone calls.(See pic for reference) when hanging around the neck the ear pieces stick outwards instead of inwards. To get them the right way you have to flip them where the Left earpiece sits on your right shoulder and Right on left shoulder.

The Baseus Inspire XH1 headphones are impressive on every level. The adaptive active noise cancelling is excellent and adjusts in real time, blocking out background noise effortlessly. The “Sound by Bose” tuning and Dolby Audio give the headphones a rich, detailed, and immersive sound that feels truly premium. Bass, mids, and highs are perfectly balanced. The build quality feels solid, the fit is comfortable for long listening sessions, and the 100-hour playtime is insane — I barely need to charge them. For this price, these headphones offer unbelievable value. Highly recommend!

I'm normally an ear bud user. With earbuds I was getting tired of the fear of them falling out on the plane if I fall asleep. I saw these  with sound by Bose and was interested. These a feature heavy for the price. Dolby audio/ spatial audio, transparency mode and noise cancelling.  Long battery life. Dual connect. LDAC support. I think you can get any kind of sound you like out of these. Clear vocals, bass heavy, balanced, etc. Used on a 5hr plane ride and noise cancellation blocked out airplane noise and loud conversations that were being had on the row behind me. Transparency mode made it to were I could hear the announcements clearly without taking the headphones off. The app is easy to use to control and change settings on the headphones. The physical buttons are easy to find. The headphones fit me well with absolutely no discomfort while wearing them. Good build quality. 10hrs of use with noise cancellation and transparency mode and it was only on 80% battery. Playing at full volume there is no distortion in the sound. I will probably use these solely for travel and commuting. I tried a different set of headphones from baseus, the Bowie MH1. The Bowie MH1 didn't perform as good as the InSpire XH1. I Could tell the sound quality in the XH1 was clearly superior to the Bowie MH1 instantly. But for their price they both were good. For $150 these are really good.

product_name: Baseus Inspire XH1 Adaptive Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Sound by Bose, Dolby Audio, Premium Real-Time Adaptive ANC, Adaptive Tuning Rich Sound, Hi-Res Audio, 100H Playtime -Twilight Blue

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Open Ear Clip-On Earbuds, Adaptive Comfort with Anti-Drop Design, Impactful Sound with Adaptive Bass Boost, Adaptive Noise Cancelling Calls, IP57 Waterproof, 40H Playtime, Lightweight

reviews.review: I use these all the time. The open ear design means I can hear my surroundings and the audio coming from the earbuds perfectly. I am an equestrian and use these with my coach so I can hear her better in crowded environments like at shows or windy days. They stay on great and never had them slip or move while I was riding or running. I recently lost the case at the airport and e-mailed the company to see if I could just buy the case since I still had the earbuds. They were kind enough to send me a new set! Not only are these earbuds fantastic quality and a great price but the customer service is top notch and quick to respond.

I really prefer open-earbuds to in-earbuds, cuz after I got some foam tips for better comfort - my ears still get "swamp ear" and get irritated after long use. So I bought Bose Ultra open buds and Shokz open fit buds. Usually I say they are good for what it’s worth. In this case, for what I paid for them, they are not worth it. I finally decided to see if there was a better alternative and stumbled upon these Baseus Bowie MC1 clip earbuds, which seemed like they could be the answer.❤🧡💛💚💙💜Pro’s:The fit is excellent, the sound is excellent, the ear clip/cuff design is different and good, the fit is pretty secure and won’t fall off, comfortable. When running I hardly noticed I had them on my ears. The sound was good when I was running.The Shokz are really good and probably rank them as one of the best hook buds in the market. For me and my ears, the Baseus is an excellent buy. These are light and fitment is excellent, the sound is superb, the call quality I give to Shokz, the update happened to both and somehow the call quality on the Baseus really improved. I still prefer the physical button over the touch sensitive approach that Shokz went with. I still like the Baseus ear clip design vs the earhook. So which do I prefer. Running and exercising-Baseus without a doubt.Bose Ultra is too expensive, can’t adjust to being closer to ear canal, left me wanting and expecting more from the ear cuff buds. They seem limited when turning them up to 7 or 8 on the flat setting. Should be priced around the Soundcore and Shokz open fit buds price, maybe even pricing them lower like $125-$150 on the high end. For $300 they should have wireless charging, multi point connectivity. Most of all a larger and louder volume level. I’m returning them. My Baseus Bowie MC1 do a better job and lasts my whole 10 hour workday without needing to be charged. These are a great option for an open-ear design at this price point, the sound is very full and balanced, impressive bass and volume without becoming distorted, I rarely feel the need to turn them up too much even when in a noisy area.❤🧡💛💚💙💜What I liked:❤1) Very comfortable, light weight, you will not even know that you are wearing it🧡2) Easy to put on and remove and just one clicker on the back of the ear on each earbud to control settings like volume, play next or previous track, take a call or end it or cycle through the modes (default list of modes can be assigned to each earbud so that you can cycle through the shortcuts you use the most).💛3) Pushing it downwards inside the ear gives a higher bass and louder sound. My ears are small so this could be different for different ear sizes. The sound quality is premium and you can move it a bit to find the right spot for best sound.💚4) Call quality is good. I did not face any issues during the call while I was walking outside💙6) You can hear the surroundings while outside, although some level of noise is reduced so that you enjoy the music.💜7) Baseus app enables you to: pair the device with your phone, calibrating the earbuds so that you get good sound quality, selecting the equalizer (bass, mid-range, treble) is available.❤8) The charging case is small and pocketable with good battery life. Up to 9-10 hours of play time and up to an extra 31 hours of battery life in the charging case.

I bought these as a second round choice to some JBL earpods I initially purchased and ended up returning immediately.The JBL earpods would not consistently stay in my ear no matter the provided ear adapter I tried.I was originally hesitant about buying these "clip-on" style ones as a replacement.But after trying them out I was extremely satisfied.They are super lightweight, comfortable, and STAY in place no matter how hard I seem to move or shake my head.I have worn them doing sweaty rough yardwork with no issues at all.Sound/volume might vary a tiny bit depending where the speaker sits in your ear once clipped on.And like all earpods, you don't get the same bass as over-ear headphones...However I think these have all around good sound and listen to rock/metal, EDM, rap, podcasts, etc on them.Charging is quick and easy.Connection/pairing seems to work extremely well and is very seamless placing in/out of the case.Range seems comparable to larger headphones.I would give them 4 1/2 stars, knocking half a star off for better bass (if possible in such a compact package).

I have tried so many earbuds, but they always fall out of my ears. I bought some other cheaper out of ear headphones, but they were garbage. These are fantastic! They stay on, I hear great through them, they hold a charge a really long time (probably about 8 hours of straight use) and the case holds a charge for about a week. They are lightweight and comfortable. A little bit of trouble with phone calls sometimes, but other times it’s fine, so it could be another issue. I love them so much!!!

These earbuds are great. These are the best earbuds that I have found. I like that it doesn’t invade my ear and the sound it’s not compromised. It has really good sound quality, the battery is great, the design it’s cute. The only thing i don’t like the size it’s a bit big for my ear but they are great and comfortable. It’s easy to connect and the weight it’s light.

First of all, I really love this open ear earbuds.  They are very comfortable, loose but still secure.  Sound is good enough, including some level of bass. Build quality is good too.  Overall I really like them and plan to keep them.HOWEVER, after a week of use, I realize the ear buds mic will stop working either when I walk away from my laptop like going to bathroom or kitchen.  It seems the disconnection is random to me.  I am not sure it's because of distance or period of not streaming.  But the worst is the mic will not work properly even the earbuds reconnect with my laptop.  I HAVE to unpair and repair the earbuds with my laptop.  As I use this earbuds for work from home meetings, this random disconnection / malfunction of mic is such a pain that finally I decided to return the earbuds.  It is such a shame.  I did see one another user commented the same issue but I thought that was random.  But in my case, it happens pretty much everyday.... so if you want to use this earbuds for meetings, be careful.  Otherwise this earbuds is almost perfect for me.

product_name: Baseus Bowie MC1 Open Ear Clip-On Earbuds, Adaptive Comfort with Anti-Drop Design, Impactful Sound with Adaptive Bass Boost, Adaptive Noise Cancelling Calls, IP57 Waterproof, 40H Playtime, Lightweight

I recently lost the case at the airport and e-mailed the company to see if I could just buy the case since I still had the earbuds. They were kind enough to send me a new set! Not only are these earbuds fantastic quality and a great price but the customer service is top notch and quick to respond.

I really prefer open-earbuds to in-earbuds, cuz after I got some foam tips for better comfort - my ears still get "swamp ear" and get irritated after long use. So I bought Bose Ultra open buds and Shokz open fit buds. Usually I say they are good for what it’s worth. In this case, for what I paid for them, they are not worth it. I finally decided to see if there was a better alternative and stumbled upon these Baseus Bowie MC1 clip earbuds, which seemed like they could be the answer.❤🧡💛💚💙💜Pro’s:The fit is excellent, the sound is excellent, the ear clip/cuff design is different and good, the fit is pretty secure and won’t fall off, comfortable. When running I hardly noticed I had them on my ears. The sound was good when I was running.The Shokz are really good and probably rank them as one of the best hook buds in the market. For me and my ears, the Baseus is an excellent buy. These are light and fitment is excellent, the sound is superb, the call quality I give to Shokz, the update happened to both and somehow the call quality on the Baseus really improved. I still prefer the physical button over the touch sensitive approach that Shokz went with. I still like the Baseus ear clip design vs the earhook. So which do I prefer. Running and exercising-Baseus without a doubt.Bose Ultra is too expensive, can’t adjust to being closer to ear canal, left me wanting and expecting more from the ear cuff buds. They seem limited when turning them up to 7 or 8 on the flat setting. Should be priced around the Soundcore and Shokz open fit buds price, maybe even pricing them lower like $125-$150 on the high end. For $300 they should have wireless charging, multi point connectivity. Most of all a larger and louder volume level. I’m returning them. My Baseus Bowie MC1 do a better job and lasts my whole 10 hour workday without needing to be charged. These are a great option for an open-ear design at this price point, the sound is very full and balanced, impressive bass and volume without becoming distorted, I rarely feel the need to turn them up too much even when in a noisy area.❤🧡💛💚💙💜What I liked:❤1) Very comfortable, light weight, you will not even know that you are wearing it🧡2) Easy to put on and remove and just one clicker on the back of the ear on each earbud to control settings like volume, play next or previous track, take a call or end it or cycle through the modes (default list of modes can be assigned to each earbud so that you can cycle through the shortcuts you use the most).💛3) Pushing it downwards inside the ear gives a higher bass and louder sound. My ears are small so this could be different for different ear sizes. The sound quality is premium and you can move it a bit to find the right spot for best sound.💚4) Call quality is good. I did not face any issues during the call while I was walking outside💙6) You can hear the surroundings while outside, although some level of noise is reduced so that you enjoy the music.💜7) Baseus app enables you to: pair the device with your phone, calibrating the earbuds so that you get good sound quality, selecting the equalizer (bass, mid-range, treble) is available.❤8) The charging case is small and pocketable with good battery life. Up to 9-10 hours of play time and up to an extra 31 hours of battery life in the charging case.

I bought these as a second round choice to some JBL earpods I initially purchased and ended up returning immediately.The JBL earpods would not consistently stay in my ear no matter the provided ear adapter I tried.I was originally hesitant about buying these "clip-on" style ones as a replacement.But after trying them out I was extremely satisfied.They are super lightweight, comfortable, and STAY in place no matter how hard I seem to move or shake my head.I have worn them doing sweaty rough yardwork with no issues at all.Sound/volume might vary a tiny bit depending where the speaker sits in your ear once clipped on.And like all earpods, you don't get the same bass as over-ear headphones...However I think these have all around good sound and listen to rock/metal, EDM, rap, podcasts, etc on them.Charging is quick and easy.Connection/pairing seems to work extremely well and is very seamless placing in/out of the case.Range seems comparable to larger headphones.I would give them 4 1/2 stars, knocking half a star off for better bass (if possible in such a compact package).

I have tried so many earbuds, but they always fall out of my ears. I bought some other cheaper out of ear headphones, but they were garbage. These are fantastic! They stay on, I hear great through them, they hold a charge a really long time (probably about 8 hours of straight use) and the case holds a charge for about a week. They are lightweight and comfortable. A little bit of trouble with phone calls sometimes, but other times it’s fine, so it could be another issue. I love them so much!!!

These earbuds are great. These are the best earbuds that I have found. I like that it doesn’t invade my ear and the sound it’s not compromised. It has really good sound quality, the battery is great, the design it’s cute. The only thing i don’t like the size it’s a bit big for my ear but they are great and comfortable. It’s easy to connect and the weight it’s light.

First of all, I really love this open ear earbuds.  They are very comfortable, loose but still secure.  Sound is good enough, including some level of bass. Build quality is good too.  Overall I really like them and plan to keep them.HOWEVER, after a week of use, I realize the ear buds mic will stop working either when I walk away from my laptop like going to bathroom or kitchen.  It seems the disconnection is random to me.  I am not sure it's because of distance or period of not streaming.  But the worst is the mic will not work properly even the earbuds reconnect with my laptop.  I HAVE to unpair and repair the earbuds with my laptop.  As I use this earbuds for work from home meetings, this random disconnection / malfunction of mic is such a pain that finally I decided to return the earbuds.  It is such a shame.  I did see one another user commented the same issue but I thought that was random.  But in my case, it happens pretty much everyday.... so if you want to use this earbuds for meetings, be careful.  Otherwise this earbuds is almost perfect for me.

product_name: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds,Secure Earhook Sport Design,Ultra-Comfort,4-Mic Clear Calls, IP57 Waterproof,45H Play, Bluetooth 6.0 Earhook Fit Running Workout Gym -White
form_factor: Open Ear earbuds /Over the ear earbuds

reviews.review: I've got to be honest, I'm blown away by the sound quality of these cheap earbuds. I downloaded the Baseus app and fooled around with the different sound settings, settling on creating a custom EQ. I admit I'm not a big bass guy but the app also has a "mega bass" setting which I activated and it added volume and a little thump that passed my limited bass comfort. The EQ (and bass) also added volume which is important since these clips rest close to your ear but not in the ear. I use the Shanling M0 Pro (2nd gen) which I've been using with wired Grado headphones in the gym. I didn't feel stupid with the big phones on my head since, afterall, the tennis pros and Lebron James come out wearing big phones. With several earlier buds the bluetooth connection on the Shanling did stumble and stutter a bit which I realized was not the buds but the player. The Baseus buds struggled the least, which leads me to conclude the bluetooth connection is probably stronger. As far as comfort, the 1st ime I tried them, 2 hours later I was in the shower sudsing up my head when you guessed it, I still had them on. I highly recommend these buds.

I'm a big fan of Baseus earbuds. These things are amazing. I gave my last one to my elderly uncle who refuses to get a hearing aid... These are pretty loud and don't crack on high volume. The bass is pretty good given they're open ear.. they're extremely comfortable and very light weight. Battery life is long enough to last all night.. I sleep with them on.
Product had great sound and comfort but did not fit my ears well. I love how you can use the app to tune them as you'd like but due to the fit I will unfortunately send them back.

This review is for Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-ear Headphones. (in case this review is lumped together with other models they sell)They sound great in quiet environments because the overall output levels can't get very loud, made worse by lower bass response than many other open ear designs.In a quiet environment they have a very clean output that sounds pretty good if you aren't playing anything with much low frequency content.  I don't mean it doesn't match basshead expectations, I mean there's country music that you will be disappointed with the lack of strong bass.  It gets more disappointing if you specifically listen to decaf/rebassed tracks or anything that plays below about 32Hz... levels roll off pretty quickly below that, being absent below 22 or 23Hz.Pressing the open ear transducers to close off the open ear gap doesn't help much.  They are about as good as they are gonna get in their natural positions.They are good for most music.Their bluetooth range is pretty impressive.Battery endurance is super good due to truncated bass response below about 30Hz.  Usually I am seeing 12-14 hours on a single full charge, running down to 15-20% remaining.  This is a mix of music, YouTube, calls, and idle time in my work day.Comfort is really good: I can put them over my ears at 7AM and take them off at 9PM without ear fatigue or discomfort.  That beats my AfterShokz models which are bone conduction for comfort, though sound clarity is superior with these Baseus headphones.A breeze above 15mph makes phone calls disappointing, but below that or indoors they are actually great for calls.I will be buying a different set in the near future and giving these to a friend that mostly stays indoors.  Not for me, as I spend a lot of time outside in a windy state.I tried all supported Codecs, and leave them connected by LDAC or AptX HD.  These are good enough to tell the difference between higher bit rate codecs and SBC easily.My biggest issue is that they don't get loud enough for use in a noisy city street, and secondary they roll off the bass output above the bottom end of typical modern country, R&B, or Hip Hop music tracks.I am not looking for extra bass, only balanced bass that accurately plays evenly down to what an organ or bass drum should sound like.So, tldr: good soundfield recreation if you are okay with truncated bass spectrum and lower total output in trade for excellent battery endurance.

Very reasonable. Loud and clear! I mostly wear one at a time at work and one is good enough to hear music clearly and the outside noise. When both are in, I cant hear anything outside unless the volume is very low. Great earphones for the price. I would definitely purchase these again. As a matter of fact, I tried ordering 3 more pairs for Christmas gifts but the order was delayed and wouldn't arrive on time. I was unfortunately, forced to cancel. I'll try again after the New Year of 2026!

I purchased these based on a New York Times Wirecutter recommendation. I'm used to bone conducting headsets, so this form factor was different. They were a little awkward to put on, but only slightly - I likely would have gotten used to it in time. I appreciated that they had physical buttons, making it easy to play/pause, fast-forward and so on (although the buttons could be a little larger). It's not clear if there's a way to turn them off without putting them in the case. The intention is clearly to carry the case around with you at all times - a little awkward, as the case isn't tiny.These didn't interfere with my glasses and I had no significant issues with comfort for long-term wear, at least not from a couple days of use. (I'm practically always listening to podcasts and audiobooks, so I wear a Bluetooth headset all day long). Wearing them around other people may be off-putting: although these are open-ear headsets, so you can still hear normally, it LOOKS like you have headphones in your ears, so people may assume you aren't listening.My only major issue is battery life. The listing is proud to claim 45 hours of battery life... but that's talking about the charge in the case, not in the earpieces. Supposedly the earpieces should last 8 hours. I didn't measure it very scientifically, but my impression was that they lasted about 2-3 hours. Even if I'm wildly mistaken, they definitely wouldn't last more than 5 hours. So these are only useful if you're putting them in the case and letting them recharge multiple times a day. That's not how I use Bluetooth headsets: I leave them on all day so I can play audio anytime, and often for long periods of time. These are fine for a workout, but not for all-day use.
